It's really hard to express exactly how I feel about this game, part of me wants to praise it while another part of me can't deal with the various problems that are presented throughout the experience. But after much reflection, a negative rating seems more appropriate due to the weight between reward and cost.

[h3]THE GOOD AND MAJESTIC THINGS[/h3]
It's certainly not a game that I would say deserves the title of "polished" but it certainly comes very close, the progression system is casual, it didn't make me feel forced to have to go after every single thing seconds into the game.

Each part of the story connects well, the narrative is not boring and maintains the right pace without getting lost too much between locations.

For those who played old games similar to grinding, with skills to create specific items for each activity (Herbalism, Weaponsmith, Tailor, etc.), you will have a great experience.

Without a doubt, one of my biggest compliments is the game's sound design, oh boy are they SATISFYING to listen to, from the sounds of harvesting, combat, and even notifications, they fit well without breaking the rhythm and immersion of the game.

[h3]THE HORRIFIC AND SCARY THINGS[/h3]
The price of this game (R$ 327.89) in my country is completely absurd for the amount of content it has (low, for the price), and since the game already has a very low population of players, this price will only drive more and more people away from even trying it.

Is there a battle pass inside an MMO? Along with an DLC expansion that is practically half the price of the base game, AND that locks a new mechanic? (Mounts and Weapons) Another game for the serious cases of infection coming from premium things in a game that is ALREADY PAID.

The Early game is the best experience of the game, where all its history, mechanics and plot are presented in a stupendous way, but after that, it becomes monotonous, the game itself no longer knows where to go or how to proceed, and then it becomes something more generic.

In resume,
I don't recommend it because has a very low active playerbase, it's a very expensive game, which has more paid content inside, plus expansion, plus cosmetics, plus battle pass, plus DLC that blocks game mechanics.
A little grindy to say the least but a whole lot of fun and a time sink. A good alternative to the usual mmorpg.

Da ich die ganzen Negativen Bewertungen hier gar nicht nachvollziehen kann und mir persönlich das Spiel extrem gut gefällt, möchte ich euch hier meine eigene Meinung zum Spiel dalassen:

Auch ich musste die ersten Stunden ein bisschen warm werden mit dem Spiel und den vielen Möglichkeiten, dass es bietet. Zuallererst ist es mal ein Buy - To - Play Titel. Das ist für mich schon mal sehr gut, da es keine Monatlichen Kosten hat. 

Es gibt ingame zwar einen kaufbaren Season - Pass, den man allerdings nicht gezwungenermaßen kaufen muss. Obwohl es einen kaufbaren gibt, wurde hier trotzdem an alle Spieler gedacht, da es einen kostenlosen Season Pass gibt. Und hier sind tatsächlich auch tolle Dinge dabei und auch keinen Müll, den man von so manch anderem MMORPG kennt. Hier gibt es auch mal Skins, die man bekommt oder sogar Währungen, mit denen man selbst etwas aussuchen darf. Für mich ist das hier tatsächlich etwas besonderes.

Hier ist wirklich für jeden etwas dabei:

- detailreiches Crafting - System
- man kann eigene Charaktere erstellen
- es gibt zwar die Holy Trinity (Tank , DD, Heal) aber man kann hier jede Waffe tragen, die man möchte
- Skills werden erlernt, indem man das tut, was man möchte. Man kommt z.B. im Crafting weiter und höher, wenn man es macht. Man nutzt die Waffe, die einem gefällt und levelt sie dadurch.
- Dungeons (Achtung: hier kann man nur mit mind. 3 Spieler rein. Alles darunter geht hier leider nicht, mehr ist möglich)
- Raids
- Tolles Housing System. Hier kann man sogar erbeutete Trophäen ausstellen, um Boni zu bekommen. Nicht nur toll dekorieren, sondern auch davon profitieren. Allerdings zahlt man an die momentan herrschende und inhabende PVP Gruppe Steuern. Diese allerdings sorgt dafür, dass die Stadt upgegradet wird mit diesen Steuern. Davon profitiert man dann wieder selber. Also ein dynamisches System.
- es gibt PVE und PVP - beides kann und nichts muss. Für mich ein Riesen Vorteil =) 
- Fischen, was sehr intuitiv ist.
- es gibt eine Gruppensuche
- man kann Companin erstellen, was Gilden gleichkommt
- Im Game selbst gibt es 3 Fraktionen, die wichtig fürs PVP sind. Diese kann man allerdings alle 30 Tage wechseln, falls man möchte. 
- Emotes nutzen und sogar Musik spielen, indem man sich selbst oder andere Spieler Buffs geben kann. 
Auch kann man hiermit Geld verdienen und mit anderen gemeinsam musizieren =D 
- Mounts, die man sich selber erspielen kann (hier benötigt man allerdings Angry Earth DLC)
- es gibt auch einen ingame Shop, der allerdings weder aufdringlich ist, noch schnell zu finden. Zudem gibt es hier keine Dinge, die einen weiter bringen oder das Game maßgeblich beeinflussen. Lediglich Skins zum verschönern, die man haben kann, aber nicht muss =D 

Man kann auch unglaublich viel auf der Karte erkunden. Überall hat man Quest, die man erledigen kann. Hier geht es von Gebietsquests bis hin zu kleineren Quest, die man von z.B. Gegenständen wie einer Kette, erhält. 

Aber auch ein bisschen Negatives gibt es von meiner Seite aus:

- innerhalb von Städten ist es trotz guter Hardware sehr ruckelig und stockend. Gerade zu den normalen "Gamezeiten" am Abend und am Wochenende.
- die Deutsche Übersetzung ist mehr wie Grauenhaft. Vor allem das Gendern ist hier nur noch lachhaft und so im Vordergrund z.B. bei den Titeln (Naturliebhaber*in......) dass es weder Sinn noch Verstand hat. Auch in den Quests ist es sehr verwirrend. Da ist mal ein Mann, der von anderen plötzlich als "Sie" angesprochen wird und der Quest den kompletten Sinn wegnimmt, da man ewig nach "ihr" sucht... oder die Quest absolut nicht verstehen kann. Für mich geht so etwas gar nicht und gehört hier auch nicht hin.
Hier muss ich leider sagen, dass ich mich entschieden habe, auf Englisch zu stellen, da dies viel besser, runder und schöner ist. An meinem Beispiel der Titel: Hier steht dann Nature Lover. Viel besser oder? 
Man muss sich nicht überall die Deutsche Sprache zerstören lassen und ehrlich gesagt, ist dass Englisch hier leicht zu verstehen. Sollte es euch dennoch schwer fallen, ist es sogar möglich Untertitel einzustellen =D 

Ansonsten kann ich allerdings nicht meckern. Alles, was man hier macht, sei es Crafting, Dungeons, Fischen usw. hat alles Sinn und man spürt merklich, dass man seinen Charakter weiter bringt und alles einen Zweck hat. 

Ich kann euch das Spiel nur empfehlen. Ob Roleplayer, Abenteurer oder einfach mal in andere Welten eintauchen: Hier findet ihr einen schönen Ort, wo man viel erleben kann. Alleine oder mit Freunden und Partner- es lohnt sich vorbeizuschauen.

Klare Empfehlung und euch viel Spaß =D

Let me tell you how my relaxing evening spiraled into madness.

I spawned on the beaches of Aeternum, shirtless, confused, and wielding a sword made of regret. Within 10 minutes, I had joined a faction that promised eternal glory (and discounts on repair kits), chopped down half the island's trees like a caffeinated lumberjack, and got mugged by a pack of wolves because I tried to pet one.

The combat? Imagine Dark Souls met Skyrim at a Renaissance fair. It's crunchy, satisfying, and sometimes you’ll block the wrong way and get slapped into next week by a zombie in a pirate hat.

I tried crafting. An hour later, I had 300 rawhide, 47 iron ingots, and absolutely no idea what I was doing. But hey—I made a pair of boots so nice I wore them in real life for emotional support.

Joined a war once. Lasted 6.7 seconds. Didn’t even see the guy who killed me. Might’ve been an actual god.

Also, there’s a killer turkey named Turkulon. He shows up once a year to ruin your day and humble entire armies. I saw 20 players die in unison and honestly? It brought a tear to my eye.

Pros:

Beautiful world, full of things to mine, chop, skin, and get lost in.

Combat that rewards skill… or panic-rolling.

Players who will either help you or sell you a healing potion for 900 gold.

Cons:

Inventory management is now my part-time job.

I forgot what real sunlight looks like.

Final Score: 10/10, would die to a turkey again.

I've tried a few times to get into New World, but I really struggle. It's not because the game isn't good looking, this game is BEAUTIFUL! The story seems really good too, at least in the first part of the game. It's by far the best and most immersive game you'll ever play, it's really quite breathtaking. The problem for me, is the combat. Coming from the holy trinity (Wow, FF14, GW2) it's more like a souls-like combat, which I hate! It was obviously designed for controller, which it does excellently. It plays AMAZING on Steam Deck, fits the little handheld perfectly! However, as an MMORPG, the combat is so basic and boring. Sadly, that's the main hook with a game like this, and New World doesn't feel like an MMORPG to play. I mean the towns are packed with players so it looks like an MMO, but combat really does feel like a souls-like.

I've reviewed this once before in 2023 on another account. Came to revisit the game 2 years later.

This is a really fun game, and it's very immersive with lots to do but has a really strange player base. If you're someone who likes fishing, wood chopping, hunting, harvesting, mining, crafting weapons and armor, etc, you will probably like this game. If you are familiar with Runescape, it is very similar to that game with all the skills you can level such as the ones previously mentioned. If you like Elder Scrolls Online, you might like this as well. If you like doing nothing but standing in town and trading at the auction house, there's that as well. You can also own houses and decorate them.

Combat is very fun and actually feels like you're making contact with the enemy compared to other MMO's such as WoW. There are lots of quests if you're someone who likes questing by yourself. 2 years ago I used to skip through some of the main quests because I thought it was just boring honestly, but ever since they overhauled it a little bit and introduced Rise of the Angry Earth I have been enjoying myself a lot more and not skipping quests. There are also mounts now, 2 years ago they did not exist and you had to run everywhere on foot (though you have to buy the dlc to access the mounts which I think is silly). Not a huge complaint about buying the dlc to access mounts because at the end of the day the entire game is free and you only really have to pay once and then the rest of the game is yours to play forever with no subscription bulls**t, which is great.

The graphics are really amazing. I love exploring zones like Edengrove because of how colorful and exotic it looks, and also the surrounding woods from the Windsward area. Sometimes I just go right outside of Windsward and just chop trees for like 30 minutes simply because of how pretty nature looks in this game. They did an excellent job with the environments and the overall atmosphere of the game, which is why I think it is extremely immersive.

The community is still weird like I remember it. Lots of arguing, s**t talking, trolling, stage 5 clinger type personalities, you name it, people saying "dEaD gAmE" every 2 seconds like 9 year olds (doesn't seem as bad now, 2 years ago it was incessant though). Some random person once private messaged me wanting to go troll people for some strange reason (I guess because they saw something I said in chat and got the wrong impression of me due to misinterpretation of tone through text, etc). I ignored them because I thought they were an idiot. So they got mad and started harassing me for not wanting to be mean to other people, but the thing is that I didn't do or say anything that could have given them the idea that I logged in this game specifically to be a moron. I guess their own goofy perception told them I was a sociopath like they were based on a comment I made? It makes absolutely no sense and I still scratch my head about it lol. Also, I remember having a question about a character in the game in regards to the story (nature lady, I believe Adiana Theron is the characters name) asking why she is so angry at humanity and someone came out of nowhere and said "You must not be married, that was a jab at women". 

I sat for like 5 minutes trying to rationalize and figure out how their comment had anything at all to do with the question I asked (made absolutely no sense). Some of these people will take the smallest things and turn it into something that has absolutely nothing to do with anything at all just for the sake of conversation and trolling, I just don't get it.... but I guess that's the nature of MMO's in general. If you don't speak these people's lingo, you'll be confused. Perhaps I am witnessing a bit of brainrot and I don't realize it? Who knows. Makes my brain hurt honestly. Stuff like this is why 2 years ago I said "Stay away from global chat or your IQ will drop a lot if you engage" and based on my personal experiences I still stand by that. My personal theory is that the game's community is the way it is because of PvP being a heavy focus in New World, and in turn that will attract edgelords and super toxic types lol. It's the same thing with WoW, amazing game and really beautiful world filled with the most terrible and goofiest people you can imagine. It's sad really, but I digress.

But don't get me wrong, as I said, this is a very good game and you will most likely be immersed in it's gorgeous world and perhaps have fun with tradeskills or pvp stuff if you enjoy going to war with other people. If you're an introverted type of person you will probably still enjoy this game, there is something for everyone here. Personally, my wife and I like to stay to ourselves and play together, farm, quest, etc. Allows us to keep our sanity lol.

As you can see by my hours I've definitely had my fun in this game. But there are serious development issues, they will never keep up with the players content cravings, in fact they really don't add much content at all.

The game has been out for like 3-4 years now and all they've done is rework after rework of the same content that they had already in the pipeline on launch, they keep adding new dungeons that don't matter at all instead of making the dozen or so dungeons that they already have into viable ways to play and progress. The raid was fun but it was really hard to find groups that could finish it for a while until all the noobs quit the game, but that'snot at all how you want that problem to be solved.

Pvp has been a balancing nightmare the whole time regardless of bugs the range meta is pure cancer and makes playing melee almost imposibble if you want to actually have fun. If you play games for fun then this aint it.

gathering and crafting was viable as a way to gain wealth and progress but they've reworked it so much that people don't want to gather because they have no idea if the stuff they pick up will be worth it in a month or two.

The boss fights are fun but all the open world mobs are a bit lackluster and copy paste, you'll notice after the first few hours that you fight the same stuff with new names and maybe a reskin, kinda boring after a bit.

The state of the game is just dead now, I don't think that will change as long as the current development and management stay the same and I've lost hope for it changing.

Great MMORPG! Loved it from level 1 till 65, well built crafting system, cool dungeons / raids / trials, love the way you can do everything from one character without needing alts like other MMO. You are always rewarded for your time spent in the game, no matter what you do, as little as it is or as much as it is, you always are rewarded accordingly. Any MMO lover must give it a try. Community is great compared to other MMO I played and I like that staff is acting quickly on reports against players who are toxic. Great discord server as well, with possibilies to give feedback on anything regarding the game and a membert of staff always answers, quite often also taking into consideration and making changes in future patches for the benefit of the players! Good job Amazon Games!

If you’ve ever played Neverwinter, the Dungeons & Dragons MMO, you might recognize some similarities in New World. Both share a somewhat simple combat system at first glance, but New World stands out by offering a more refined and rewarding experience. Unlike Neverwinter, which is often criticized for its problematic monetization and pay-to-win mechanics, New World manages to avoid these pitfalls, allowing players to focus on the game without constant distractions from microtransactions.

Combat System:

At first, New World’s combat may seem simplistic—at least in comparison to some other MMOs. However, the more you play, the more you’ll appreciate the underlying depth. If you’ve ever played World of Warcraft (or any other game with a tab-targeting system) and found yourself wishing there was a bit more skill required in landing those chaotic, powerful attacks, New World will scratch that itch.

The combat system is dynamic and engaging, requiring real-time positioning, dodging, and aiming. It's a refreshing take on the traditional MMO combat mechanics, and it provides a level of satisfaction that’s hard to come by in games that lean too heavily on a "press-button-and-wait" approach. Whether you're wielding a sword, casting spells, or swinging a warhammer, every action feels deliberate and impactful, making the battles feel more like a test of skill than simple number crunching.

Story and World Design:

One of the standout features of New World is its incredible world-building. The environment is amazingly crafted, and the level of detail in both the visuals and the lore is remarkable. From the dense forests and foggy swamps to the snow-covered mountains, each area has its own unique feel and atmosphere. It's clear that the developers put a lot of thought into creating a living, breathing world that’s rich in history and filled with opportunities for discovery.

The story itself is intriguing, though it serves more as a backdrop for the exploration and survival elements. That said, the world of Aeternum—the setting of New World—has enough depth to pull you in and keep you invested in its mysteries. Whether you’re uncovering ancient ruins or delving into the story behind the corruption that plagues the land, the narrative weaves seamlessly into the gameplay, offering plenty of incentives to explore every nook and cranny.

Crafting System:

The crafting system in New World is another highlight. It's comprehensive without feeling overwhelming. There’s a real sense of satisfaction when you gather resources and craft items, whether it’s weapons, armor, or consumables. The system is complex enough to feel rewarding but doesn't require excessive grinding or micromanagement. Whether you’re an experienced crafter or someone new to the mechanic, there’s something deeply satisfying about creating items that directly impact your gameplay. Plus, the materials and crafting stations are scattered across the world, making crafting an integral part of your journey, not just a side activity.

Overall Impressions:

So far, I don’t have a lot of negative things to say about New World. The game excels in so many areas: the skill-based combat, the stunning world design, and the rewarding crafting system all come together to create an experience that feels fresh and exciting. There’s a good balance of depth without overwhelming the player, and the attention to detail in the game world is evident in every corner.

If you’re someone who’s looking for a traditional MMO experience with more skill-based combat and a world that feels alive, New World is definitely worth checking out. It’s a refreshing change from the typical MMO formula, and whether you’re a fan of Neverwinter, World of Warcraft, or other MMOs, this game brings something new to the table without the frustrating pay-to-win mechanics.

Difícil na verdade falar se eu recomendo New World. Foi uma aposta do estúdio de jogos da Amazon para com o público de MMO e vou te falar que foi uma ousadia em tanto. O jogo consegue acertar em vários pontos sendo história, design de produção e alguns sistemas de guerra que eu achava muito legais. Agora para os pontos negativos poderia resumir na falta de experiência da Amazon Games em fazer jogos e apostar num gênero tão difícil de entregar. Indo mais à fundo seria as missões vazias (ou fat quests) que deixam a gameplay muito mais tediosa, o endgame sendo um farm gigantesco e repetitivo para conseguir itens melhores, mas o pior de tudo é sentir que a Amazon Games não escuta direito a comunidade. Isso tudo acabou afastando muitos players o que é uma pena. Foi meu primeiro e último MMO pois esse gênero consome muito tempo e preciso viver, porém guardarei com carinho o prazer e jogar um jogo tão social e ter vários momentos felizes com a galera da guilda.

Recomendo? Pelo preço atual jamais, e ainda que a playerbase está aos poucos indo embora. Felizmente esse jogo tem várias coisas que interessam as pessoas, só falta a desenvolvedora saber explorar bem isso e se aproximar mais da comunidade. Eu sempre mantenho um olho nele para ver se estão fazendo certo, mas tantos anos após o lançamento eu já nem sei se continuo com esperanças.

Un MMO sin gente tóxica.
Predomina la comunidad de Brasil.
En cuanto a las armas, hay un abanico muy amplio que te habilita a jugar lo que vos quieras. Si queres ser tank de aguante, tenes varias formas de hacerlo, si queres ser tank y aportar daño/utilidad, tambien tenes varios recursos. Si queres curar, podes hacerlo con el báculo de vida en el arma principal y en la secundaria podes tener un arma que aporte utilidad al equipo o también daño. En cuando a los DPS, hay miles de combinaciones que podes usar. Dependiendo de donde vayas, si raid, mazmorra o pvp, podes elegir el arma que mas se adapte a tu forma de juego. En caso de raid (la tipica 1 vez x semana y tal) hay armas que sirven mas que otras por su forma de juego, por sus habilidades y es bastante interesante estudiarlo. Si te gusta el PvE, lo mas parecido a una mitica plus en el wow es hacer mazmorras en tiempos records, tambien usando determinadas armas, determinada composición con respecto a tus otros 4 compañeros. En cuanto al PvP puedo decir que podes pelear con cualquier arma.
 El juego te da la info, te toca leerla, entenderla y encontrar tu roll dentro de este precioso mundo de new world. 
Cabe recalcar que no todo depende de que armas uses, sino que tambien dependes del equipo que lleves. Casco, pechera bla bla, joyería.. Como en todo MMO serio, hay estadísiticas y beneficios que debes respetar para que tu equipo sea lo mas excelente posible, pero ya te digo, hay millones de formas para equiparse, millones de "builds". Eso es bastante atrapante, lo prometo.
 En cuanto a la gente, como mencioné, no es tóxica.. Suele pasar de que la misma comunidad pone en la lista negra a quienes intentas pasarse de graciosos y se genera un gran ambiente.
 El juego es pago, no es para nada ptw, y la comunidad es pequeña. Tienen que mejorar en algunos aspectos como bajarle el precio al juego o promocionarlo mas para que haya mas atracción. Como todo MMO, necesitas tiempo para todo. Nada es gratis y las cosas cuestan lo que tiene que costar.
 Recomiendo muchisimo ver algun PoV de Raid ya sea gorgonas o gusano para que veas que en este juego existen las mecanicas y hay que usar discord si o si para coordinar entre varios. 
 Jugué toda mi vida al wow, desde muy chico que me encantaba ver los MDI. Por cuestiones de trabajo+universidad tuve que dejar ese juego. Ahora que estoy estabilizado con mis proyectos personales, no tengo tiempo para wow pero si para New World y si estas en la misma que yo, este juego es para vos. Garantizo algunas horitas de diversion y entretenimiento! Espero que la info haya sido suficiente, un abrazo

The game is carried by build diversity (very enjoyable to theorycraft) and combat system (soulslike, let's say). 

The rest is trash. I've expent lots of hours waiting for new content (PVP, in my case), never came. At endgame point you have about 8-10 types of content, but you only can get the best gear doing pve (raids, dependant on other people) or crafting it (after farming dozens of hours). Most of the gear adquisition is unnecesarily timegated ("you can get only X material once a week").

The endgame loop is basically horrible and the company does not listen the comunity. They waste their resources adding unnecessary stuff that nobody asked for while the playerbase is dwindling by days. They did from scratch THREE TIMES the main questline to get max level, while endgame content is non-existent. 

It's really sad to see how a potentially very good game is destroyed by a really bad directives. But whatever.

I would really not recommend wasting time in this game.

So yet again another review. I started New World on Dec 25th 2023 and beat the game in about 2-3 weeks.
From that time that I first played(i played some before Aeternum released)all the way up until now, I can see this game has made drastic improvements. I played alot before the major update released and yes the game was pretty fun, back to the time where Archetypes didnt exist and you just started the game on the beach and had a basic sword. I can firmly say that with the combat improvements, world and story improvements/changes and with the addition of new stuff, that I can indeed recommend this to someone who is looking for a new mmo or looking for something different from Black Desert or something. Though the one thing that is repeating itself, are the events. One event in particular stands out as one of the most repeated event being the Legacy of Crassus(yes I know, pretty much all if not most of the events are constantly copied and pasted). Anyways.
Game: 7.5/10 (5/10 for pre Aeternum)
Graphics: 6/10
Combat: 8/10
Story: 10/10

New World is a solid MMO with enjoyable combat and a world that’s fun to explore, but the story is a bit strange and doesn't really draw you in. When I first played, the game was more of a grind, especially with Azoth management—it felt like you were constantly hoarding it to fast travel, but nowadays, you could never run out of Azoth if you tried. The addition of mounts helped improve travel, making getting around much faster. Over time, the game has solidly improved, and it’s become an MMO I return to whenever I’m in the mood to dive into something online. It may not be perfect, but it’s definitely a fun and evolving experience.

Just wish I had spent my 550 hours on something else before realizing this game deeply disrespects its players at every level from design and QC to monetization and marketing. For far less money, there are much more polished and robust MMOs with pvp on the market.

🔹 New World – Review (144+ Hours Played) 🔹

After 144+ hours in New World, I’ve explored every corner of Aeternum, from sun-drenched beaches to frostbitten peaks, and thrown myself into countless territory wars. Here’s my veteran take:

👍 Pros:

✔ Immersive Exploration – Aeternum’s biomes (lush jungles, misty swamps, snowy highlands) are gorgeous, and stumbling on hidden shrines or dynamic world events never gets old.
✔ Deep Crafting & Player Economy – Gathering, refining, and crafting gear feels impactful. Playing the auction house and cornering a market on rare materials is genuinely satisfying.
✔ Epic Faction PvP – Outpost Rush and 50v50 Territory Wars are adrenaline-pumping. Coordinated sieges with siege weapons and strategic choke points make for memorable battles.
✔ Flexible Combat Builds – With five weapon types and armor weights, you can go light-and-agile with dual blades or slow-and-strong with halberds and heavy plate. Dodge mechanics and weapon synergies keep combat engaging.
✔ Steady Live Updates – Amazon’s added new expeditions, quality-of-life patches, and seasonal events since launch, smoothing out many rough edges.

👎 Cons:

❌ Late‑Game Grind – Chasing gold‑tier gear demands repetitive boss runs, crafting loops, and gear score farming. Once capped, goals narrow to PvP ranks or cosmetic drops.
❌ Technical Hiccups – Server desync, rubber‑banding, and occasional quest bugs still pop up, breaking immersion. Some expeditions have pathing or trigger issues that require resets.
❌ Population & Queues – High‑traffic zones can lock and spawn long queues; low‑pop servers struggle to fill faction fights.
❌ Faction Imbalance – Many servers see one faction dominate territories, making it tough for underdogs to catch up unless you reroll.
❌ Repetitive PvE Tasks – After unlocking fast travel, most side missions feel like “kill X” or “gather Y,” which can become rote.

⚖ Final Verdict:

New World is at its best when you’re adventuring with a company, mastering a quirky weapon build, or laying siege to a fortress under a blood‑red moon. But the endgame grind, server quirks, and occasional bugs can wear you down. If you love open‑world PvPvE, deep crafting, and large‑scale warfare—and don’t mind repetitive loops—this will keep you busy for a long time.

⭐ 8/10 – A beautiful, ambitious MMO that rewards camaraderie and strategy, but tempered by grind and technical rough spots.

Ich kann New World Aeternum nur wärmstens empfehlen! 

[b]Für alle neuen Spieler: Ihr müsst nicht das Hauptspiel plus Add-ons kaufen, wenn ihr die Standard- oder Deluxe-Version wählt – ist  "Rise of the Angry Earth" bereits enthalten.[/b]

Das Spiel ist einfach großartig, riesig und bietet eine unglaublich umfangreiche Welt, in der für jeden etwas dabei ist. Es macht wirklich Spaß, egal ob beim Angeln, bei PvP-Schlachten oder beim Erkunden der vielfältigen Inhalte.

Der PvE-Content ist beeindruckend vielfältig, und das Jagen nach Schatztruhen und Ressourcen für das Crafting motiviert mich jeden Tag aufs Neue. Die Grafik, die Musik und der Stil sind stimmig und tragen dazu bei, dass New World zu einem der besten MMOs wird, die ich je gespielt habe. Besonders die Action-RPG-Elemente machen das Spiel einzigartig in seinem Bereich.

Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist top: Für das Geld bekommt man einen riesigen Titel mit einer voll vertonten Story, [b]ohne monatliche Abogebühren.[/b] Es gibt einen optionalen Battle Pass, einen Premium-Shop und kosmetische Items, aber alles ist optional.

Kurz gesagt: Für alle, die auf der Suche nach einem umfangreichen, gut gemachten MMO sind, ist New World definitiv eine tolle Wahl. Also, auf nach Aeternum!

Nice MMO with good graphics which can run on older machines. The combat is the best in any MMO I have ever played, it is skill based and not too complicated as there are 3 skills you can use per weapon with 2 active swappable weapons. It's not class-locked so you can swap weapons out of combat.

This game has progressively worsened since 2023 with shifting priorities, broken code and combat imbalances. Played a bunch in early launch and consistently try to give the game a go up into 2025 after each iterative update, only to see noticeable decline with each release and the followed disappointment. 

The game really had stuff going for it with unique combat mechanics, great world design and high quality visual/audio that set a new bar for comparable games.  It's just not what it used to be, and could have been great had the development stayed true to it's creation.  

Enjoyed my time playing it and may briefly comeback with future world expansions, but I believe the player base mostly hold the same sentiment that the game would need a massive overhaul to gain any consistent return to this.

Pros:  
A great alternative to World of Warcraft, which I have played since 2006.  I'm not a PVP guru, but I can see why this game appeals to those who are.  If you are a profession lover and/or one who likes to farm materials for profession leveling or selling to make gold, then you will definitely enjoy your time in this game.  Character builds are definitely plenty and being able to switch these up with short downtime is a big plus.    

Cons:  
Lack of storage options - No central bank option for companies like say, World of Warcraft has to help out players within your company.  No way of using one character to help out another character as there is not an account wide storage.  Plenty of space to be utilized, but being able to maybe trade in some of this storage for your own account would be beneficial.  

All in all, I give this game an A+ or 8.5/10.

The main concepts of this game are fun and engaging. Builds are great to play with, the game looks and feels gorgeous, and I have had many fun hours playing it. So why do I not recommend it? Because of the one thing this game just cant get right. The end game.

Levelling to max level (65) is fun, but very very fast. Before you know it you're there and you're asking yourself "what now?". The answer? PvP. Yes that's right, take part in all the PvP aspects of the game. Cool, you may think. I love a bit of PvP action. Step into a war or an outpost rush and get absolutely creamed in a second. Why? Because your gear is trash and to be even remotely competitive you have to spend hundreds of hours grinding out crafting levels so that you can upgrade your gear to be remotely decent so that you can be dragged through the highest level content (because, lets face it, your gear is still trash), to have a remote chance to get a piece of gear that is going to be what you need to make your build decent. Before all of this, don't even bother getting into that PvP stuff, you will just lose.

The game has no balancing to speak of. You are not put into content against players with similar gear score, not that that would help you as the power difference between a very high 710 gear score and the max (725) is that vast, that the 710 can barely even scratch the 725.

So how do you get there? How do you get to that last 15 gear score that seemingly turns you from a feeble peasant into a master of death and destruction? GRIND... grind your a$$ off!!! I'm not talking about Elite: Dangerous levels of grind (love that game btw), no no no... Elite's grind levels have nothing on this game. If you've ever played Elite, then you know what I am talking about. How any game could beat that in terms of grinding is beyond me, and yet, I give you New World!

So lets say you need to get yourself to level 250 in Engineering. You would start by crafting 28 Treated Wood Bows to get to level 50. This requires 336 Timber, 336 Rawhide and 56 Linen. Doesn't sound too bad, right? Let me go on...

To get from level 50 to 100, you're best off crafting 89 Lacquered Wood Spears. This requires 979 Lumber, 445 Iron Ingot  and 178 Course Leather. But to make the Lumber, you need 2 Timber for every 1 piece of Lumber, so add to that recipe 1,958 Timber. For every Iron Ingot, you need to farm up 4X that amount if Iron Ore, so that is 1,780 Iron Ore that you have to find.

These numbers get worse the higher in quality you go. All recipes require 2 for 1 of the previous tier till you get to the top tier. To get from 205 Engineering to 250, you need to make an astonishing 178 Mythril Blunderbuss (or relative equivalent of other recipes). This requires a grand total of 1602 Mythril Ingots. So to make 1 Mythril Ingot, you need 12 Mythril Ore, 2 Orichalcum Ingot, 1 Flux, 2 Charcoal. (I hope I'm not losing you here). The 2 Orichalcum requires 8 Ore, 2 Starmetal Ingots, 1 Flux, 2 Charcoal. Starmetal costs 6 Ore, 2 Steel Ingot, 1 Flux, 2 Charcoal. Steel costs 3 Iron Ingots, 1 Flux, 2 Charcoal. Iron Ingots cost 4 Ore.

To make 178 Mythral Blunderbuss, you need (Just the metal)
1,602 Mythril Ingots (19,224 Ore)
3,204 Orichalcum Ingots(25,630 Ore)
6,408 Starmetal Ingots (38,448 Ore)
12,816 Steel Ingots (38,448 Iron Ingots (153,792 Iron Ore))
48,060 Charcoal (96,120 Timber)
24,030 Flux (which you may find around 7 of in a chest on occasion, if you're lucky)

Do you see where I am going with this? Each node will give you from about 7 to 60 Ore depending on size and your character's gear. But that's if the node is even there in the first place because some other player has got to it first and taken it.

I made a spreadsheet detailing how much grinding you actually had to do to get just a single trade skill to 250, but gave up when I started to breach the millions of materials that you need for just 1 trade skill. "Just buy from the Trade Centre!" Yes but players have their prices set so exorbitantly high that you can go bankrupt just trying to make a few levels.

All in all this game is the biggest grindfest of a game I have ever played. You have to do the grind to be even remotely competitive, and this game is probably the worst game for any newcomer.

I tried this game early on and it just didn’t grab me. But recently, I gave it another shot—and I totally fell in love with it! They have added and tweaked a lot, making the experience way more engaging right from the start.
It does get a bit tougher once you reach the endgame, especially when it comes to finding people to run group content with. That said, the game is absolutely beautiful and packed with things to do, even if you prefer playing solo.
Personally, I think the full price is a little steep for this MMO. But if you're looking for a game that lets you play solo at your own pace, on your own schedule—and offers big group content when you're ready for it—this one is definitely worth checking out.

İlk çıktığı zamanlarda 100 TL civarına satılıyordu büyük heyecan ile aldık ve oynadık çok iyiydi combat çok eğlenceliydi. Ama saçma sapan hack haberleri ticaretin batması ve hızlıca düzeltilememesi nedeni ile oyunu 40 lvl de bıraktık. Bu sıralar mmo bulunmadığından tekrardan denemek istedim 3-4 yıl sonra girdiğimde karakterim duruyordu ve sunucuyu değiştirmem istendi sorunsuz değiştirdim ve oyuna girip tekrardan oynamaya başladım.

Şunu söylemem lazım bu kadar iyi bir combat hiç bir MMO oyunda yok. Ama hayatsız gibi oynayacak kişiler için yeterli içerik olmayabilir. Ben günde 2-3 saat takılıyorum ve gayet keyif alıyorum.

Eksik yanları. 

- Yeni hikayeler için ek paket yapılması tamam ama binek için veya herhangi bir oyun için geliştirme için ek paket yapılması tam bir saçmalık.

The game truly is a fun game. The whole colonial vibe is awesome, exploration and quests are fun, crafting is excellent, a lot of people, myself included, loved this game and was hoping it would be something more, but after almost 4 years since the original release, the only content that has been made is a re-release of the game (New World: Aeternum) so we can have cross platform play and ONE actual DLC that released back in October of 2023. So 4 years and one DLC but loads of updates to the cosmetic store so you can spend your money there. If the game is ever on sale and you have a couple of buddies that wanna try it, the standard edition wouldn't be a bad idea. But if you're looking for something that gets DLC yearly, I don't recommend this game. Elder Scrolls Online, WoW or FFXIV would be my recommendation.

PVP kann ich nicht einschätzen, muss man auch nicht betreiben. Es mangelt etwas an der Vielfalt spielerischer Möglichkeiten, die Kern-Gameplay-Mechaniken sind aber absolut akzeptabel umgesetzt. Mir scheint, dass ein überwiegender Teil der negativen Kritiken mit enttäuschten Erwartungshaltungen zu tun hat, sowie einer fragwürdigen und unprofesionellen Kommunikationspolitik. Stört mich: Die Character-Creation ist eher basic und viele der Gesichter sehen grotesk und überstilisiert aus. Die merkwürdigen Gender-Formulierungen (Xier/Xien und * in Titeln) in der deutschen Übersetzung wirken aufgesetzt, inhomogen und entsprechen auch nicht dem Sprachgebrauch der weit überwiegenden Mehrheit der Deutschsprechenden - keine Ahnung, wie man auf solche Ideen kommt. 
Die Bewertung mit "ausgeglichen" spiegelt den Production Value von New World nicht wider, vor allem wenn man bedenkt, das zb Quinfall ebenfalls eine solche Bewertung hat - und da liegen qualitativ Welten dazwischen. NW hat seinen eigenen Charme und ist definitiv eines der interessanteren westlichen MMOs der letzten Jahre.

This game started out beautifully and required real skill to play. Unfortunately, the current state—with heavy aim assist and target lock mechanics, especially on consoles—has made it nearly unplayable for PC players who value skill-based competition.
The assist features allow players with little to no skill to simply point and shoot. Shots unnaturally curve around obstacles like trees and corners, and no amount of movement or dodging seems to help. If you're a PC player looking for fair, skill-based engagements, this game may no longer be the right fit

Healers Got Gutted – Disappointed and Frustrated

As someone who has mained a healer in New World since launch, I’ve never felt more discouraged. The recent nerfs have completely ruined the experience of playing a support role. Healing is no longer fun or effective – it’s become a frustrating chore.

The changes to healing output, cooldowns, and stamina management make it feel like we’re being punished for choosing to help others instead of dealing damage. Group content is now a nightmare. I used to feel valuable in Expeditions and PvP – now I just feel like dead weight. It’s impossible to keep up with damage, especially when the enemies hit harder and our healing tools have been drastically weakened.

What’s even worse is the lack of communication or justification. It feels like the devs have caved to the loudest DPS players and forgotten the people who held groups together. Healing should be rewarding, not a constant uphill battle.

If this was meant to encourage more diverse builds, it’s backfired. Instead, you’ve driven support mains away. I’m seriously considering switching roles or quitting altogether – and I know I’m not the only one.

Fix this, New World. Support players deserve better.

I bought this game shortly after it came out because it went on sale and I liked the idea of an MMORPG that you buy once and get to play forever with no subscription fees. I played for about 5 months and while I enjoyed it, I got bored with it as it was still very raw, didn't have a lot of content, and had a lot of problems like not being able to swim and other silliness that showed it just wasn't ready for release.

Fast forward to a little over a month ago and a friend of mine starts playing because of the console release so I buy the Angry Earth update and give it a go again. 

I'm pleasantly surprised by how far this game has come. Its not a "No Man's Sky" or a "Cyberpunk 2077" style rebirth, but its a much much better game today. Now it still has issues like the lack of any real end-game, but it sounds like the development team is really small and that Amazon Game Studios isn't backing this game properly. It has great bones, but still needs more content. The community is small, but honestly pretty great as far as MMORPGs go. I'm on Pangea and its busy and alive.

I'm not sure I would pay full price for it, but if you manage to grab it while its on sale, you will likely enjoy it.

New World Aeternum is a fun, albeit flawed and high-potential MMORPG.

What works:
- Great feeling combat
- Intriguing setting
- Settlement interaction (incl. player housing)
- Survival-lite elements (good crafting and life-skills)
- Gorgeous environments to explore
- Varied enemy AI (some enemies dumb as dogshit, others have two brain cells that work relatively well together and actually dodge or block some of your attacks)
- PVP is a lot of fun 

What's ok:
- Character build variety and viability across builds
- Voice acted NPC interactions (varies in quality; sometimes audio is bugged)
- Story-telling (it's ok, nothing to write home about which is a wasted opportunity for the setting. The tone also feel really uneven and outright cartoonish in some circumstances)
- Factions are interesting but there's something missing (covered below) 
- Invasions are a cool idea but... (more below)

What's missing:
- 'Class identity/fantasy' (your weapon load-outs determine your role and which 2 stats you're gonna dump all your points into; little incentive to spread your points into other attributes outside of you main damage outputting stats resulting in little in the way of building a true identity outside of that)
- An 'indigenous' faction (you play entirely as a settler and whilst there are 'nature-aligned' people in the story, you never really get to side with them a la GreedFall. This faction could be oriented towards fighting the corruption of the island and resisting the influence of colonists)
- No incentive to specialise in specific crafting vocations (everyone can max all crafting skills like Runescape; cheapens the building of 'character identity')
- Greater variety of skill builds among weapons (combining 2 weapon types could unlock a new set of abilities that can be used when either weapon is equipped)
- The consequences for failing an invasion don't feel all that meaningful (settlement upgrades get reduced slightly; would be better if the settlement was wiped and the subsequent corruption of place had to be 'purified', 'destroyed', or 'contained for study' prior to resettlement; this would also give factions the opportunity to genuinely 'leave their mark' on the world in a meaningful way and deepen their respective character and provide more PVPVE content).
- Could lean more into survival elements (ie a weather/environmental system that has an impact on resources, character performance, weapon, armour, and tool durability to create money-sinks to benefit the economy, etc.)

Overall it's a fun game and I'm enjoying it casually. Assuming there's developer appetite for more expansions, which may sadly not be the case, some of the missing items above could be partially addressed. I think it's a good experience that struggles to be genuinely great. It makes some bold moves for the genre, but never fully commits to them which leads to some disappointing missed opportunities.

Also, the buy price is too damn high. I know this game cost heaps to make, but the box price is a real barrier to entry for lots of people. Perhaps the devs should look to FFXIV or GW2 for examples of monetisation.

Alrighty fellas, I know I am only 1,210 hours deep at the time of posting, but I figured since discord is broken that I would go ahead and post yall an honest review based on my experience.

Before anything, let me just help out and let yall know to just buy the standard edition of the game if you want to try it out, don't worry about the angry earth dlc that's still on the store, you only need the standard edition of New World Aeternum to have the full game +dlc.

Before buying New World, you must keep a few things in mind:

This game is ran by developers who don't care about the game in any way, if they did care, they would update the game once in a while, and give us fresh stuff to do without introducing a million bugs on the rare occasion that they do listen.

New World has bugs... Game is literally just a bug in itself, and you need to treat these bugs like mechanics of the game. You are likely to start noticing bugs pretty quickly, and some are pretty annoying. Please do not let this change your mind about buying the game though. I bought the game in January knowing exactly what the state of the game was, and it was in fact worth buying. You really have to go in with low expectations, that is how you set yourself up for the best possible experience.

New World is dying... New world has been dying for years. The developers don't care, and we rarely get anything new that is enough to keep the player-base strong. Latest big update was a pvp update that introduced seasonal pvp servers to the game that are just not fun for players that don't enjoy being killed constantly and jumped by 10+ players while trying to finish a quest. This update also split the already small community. We should have had more pvp related updates to bring life back to the main game, not just a server that closes at the end of the season for minimal rewards.
We need more content for those of us who already completed everything hundreds of times...

Amazon Games refuses to reward their players for grinding their content... If you are a fan of raiding, and endgame content in mmos. This game has a really good raid called Hive of Gorgons. Before I get into what it is and how to prepare for it, I want to let yall know about the weekly rewards... The Hive raid will only give you loot once per week, this includes schematics, which are used to craft endgame gear or you can sell them for a profit. I think its a 1/200 chance to get the schematic on your first clear of the week(reset day is every Tuesday at I think 5 am). If you are unlucky like me, you can do over a hundred raid clears and still not get the drop because I did not clear 100+ Hive raids by doing them once a week. I clear multiple times a week every week and only get armor and weapon drops on Tuesday reset day. 
The only thing that you do get daily that could potentially be useful, but its not for most people are the damaged gorgon's eyes. You have to do an insane amount of perfect scaled up expeditions(dungeons basically). This is just to get 1 hive cache that has a random rolled piece of gear in it from the raid. Most people don't have groups that can consistently clear these expeditions to that level which means that those eyes will just pile up until the devs decide to make a change(I recommend just holding onto them, if we are lucky, maybe they will become useful.)

Hive of Gorgons: Hive is not a piece of content that is easy to get into because the community is pretty toxic when it comes to giving new players a shot at clearing. I had to lie to get into hive raids saying that I was experienced and new what I was doing to start getting into them, and most of the time, that didn't work because they will ask to check your gear before inviting you.

If you want a chance to start getting into Hive and start getting good solid experience, please read what I am about to say:

There are multiple roles that you can play in hive, this is not exactly as simple as dps, healer, and tank. You have to build a bit more specifically if you want an invite to the raids unless you are lucky.

List of widely known roles: Tank(usually want sword and shield with the leadership perk in the skill tree to boost your groups damage by 10%. Offhand could be a few things, won't get much into that rn.)

Healers(Need a lifestaff, and void gauntlet with the oblivion perk in the skill tree. wont get into details rn).

Dps(this is the role that has a lot of diversity, and it is going to be your best shot at getting into a raid).
As a dps, there are a few main roles that are needed in a proper Hive comp. Evade Rapier, Bleed Rapier, and Rend Bot.

Evade: This is your best option to get into a raid and get some clears without people staring at you constantly. Just follow the group and work on maximizing your dps. In this game, gear score does not matter nearly as much as gear perks, so here is a list of perks to get before linking your gear to raid leaders: 4-5 pieces of enchanted ward on armor, 4 stacks of refreshing on armor/jewelry(no more than that as its max stack is 4), omnidirectional evade on an armor piece, and leeching flurry on an armor piece. Do not have regenerating on your earring as that can lead to pulling aggro from tank, avoid that heavily. Good way to find gear like that is to go into the trade post and filter for a perk until you get all of the perks needed. You will want your gear to be mostly yellow tier, with some red tier(can only have 1 artifact piece for armor, weapons, and jewelry on at a time.)
The artifacts you will want to start with to get into the raid are going to be Attuned Leather Pants(artifact pants from main story quest ending. Make sure to put health on these pants while learning so people don't question your life choices. This requires upgrading at a gypsum kiln. I won't explain how, you will just need to figure it out or research since I am limited here). Make sure to stay in a light equip load as any dps role. ALP are a medium pair of pants, so build accordingly because in a light load you get +15% damage.
Finisher(This is an artifact rapier that is pretty much best in slot if you add the perk, distained infliction as your upgraded perk. This is very important, do not leave this out in your evade build.)This rapier will be obtained in elysian wilds on the isle of zurvan. You have to get a group together to kill the 3 elemental elephants, and wait 6 minutes for the big one to spawn and kill that until you get the drop. Best way to get a group is to go into recruitment chat and say x up for finisher farm or something like that, then invite players to a group that x up in chat.
Endless Thirst(This is a solid starter artifact that helps make health potions heal for more and some other useful perks for survivability. Just put refreshing toast on it to counter the longer cooldown on potions.) 

If you have all of that stuff, you should be good to go as an evade. Just make sure you are using the rapier skills, Evade, Flurry, and Riposte or you are not playing as an evade. Please look up a build for evade rapier and follow that for the skill tree. That will help tons. 

your attributes should be set like this: 25 focus(5%cdr), 25 strength(+5% damage to melee weapons), 350 dex(as close as you can get), and the rest into intelligence. Constitution is not desired as a dps, your goal is damage, so get used to dodging attacks, but use con food if you need the extra health(attribute food from trade post).

make sure while learning to use a bow/musket as your offhand. These scale well with rapier, and are really good for first and 3rd boss. 2nd boss, always melee(its a dps check. melee does more damage with rapier, and staying on the boss avoids a bunch of mechanics.
I will not get into each of the other roles rn due to limited space. I am just posting evade in its full form because it is your absolute easiest way to get into Hive, and you can expand from there when you know the raid.

With over 400 hours spent in New World, I can say this game has been a rollercoaster of exploration, experimentation, and evolution. What first pulled me in was the sheer beauty of Aeternum and the weighty, satisfying feel of its combat system. Over time, what kept me coming back was the depth of the crafting system, the sense of progression, and the moments of large-scale conflict that actually felt meaningful. There have been ups and downs, and the game has changed quite a bit since launch, but watching it grow and improve has been part of the experience. Whether I was gathering resources deep in the wilderness, fighting alongside others in intense wars, or simply refining my build for the next challenge, New World always gave me something to sink my time into. It is not a perfect MMO, but it has a soul and a rhythm that resonates with players who enjoy investing themselves in a world that rewards patience, adaptability, and persistence.

It's trully not a bad game, I love it's mechanics, how simple it is, the pleasure it gives from playing, but continuesly bad management is just drowning this game over and over again. Whenever they do something to bring players to the game, they have to keep repeating the same mistakes. If you just want to play a game that you will like, and soon later watch how they kill it, go on.

Worth mentioning, due to constant lack of players online, you will not be able to do some of the content.

First off I want to say when I first started to play this game when it came out in 2021 I was addicted, coming from playing WoW it felt fresh and interesting and was fun and satisfying to go from completing dungeons to chopping down trees and levelling crafting skills. But after a while I lost interest as the end game felt like it was lacking the appeal to play anymore, anyone that got to endgame in 2021 knows it was not great there was little to do and the progression felt tedious. 

Because of this I stopped playing, but when I saw they were re-launching the game I thought the developers might actually be trying to do something, so I when it re-released as New World Aternum I thought why not try it out. 

When starting a new character to see the new starter area I felt the abundance of NPC dialogue was nothing but slop that they felt they had to write so the characters didn't just seem like mannequins staring at us, as I continued to play it seemed like there weren't many changes to combat and AI movement with the mobs and that is where I decided to stop playing. Needles to say I was disappointed that the game felt worse.

Also the fact that end game is locked behind a $50 dollar DLC when the game is $90 is absolutely ridiculous and honestly disgusting to see for the developers to do, it really made trying to get friends to get back in the game with me so hard, as I was riding around on a mount they asked "how do you get that?" and I disappointingly had to respond saying you have to spend $30 dollars to be able to get mounts in the game, and they were pretty put off by that which is fair.

Overall the changes were fine but I felt there was nothing drawing me back into the game. I would not recommend playing this game if you are a hardcore mmo player but if you are casual player I would say the game is ok but there a better games out there.

I played this game at launch, and really loved it. I no lifed it for like 2 weeks until the fiasco started with chat bug sausages, immortality exploits and so on. 

I just came back after years, because I told myself "this game was amazing, for sure they fixed the insane bugs right?" and YES they did.

Aeternum is a waaaay more polished version of the original game. The Main Story Quest leveling is amazing, the new zones are amazing, new weapons are cool. Everything is just so much better. They made more niche changes that improved the game a lot, which a total noob will not see, for example healers would stay in heavy armor and be immortal. That is not a thing anymore because you get -30% healing when you are in heavy.

Housing system is nice, crafting is nice, gathering is really satisfying. They made these interesting sounds when you kill something or when you gather, kinda like Battlefield or other FPS "clink" sound, which is very addictive.

Open world PvP is just insane and I started a regional war just last night because I was camped by 6 purple dudes. Called in the boys and it was a literal battlefield. In what MMORPG can you hide in bushes, making your name plate disappear? You can ambush people!

Honestly, people are trashing the game too much and that's just because modern gamers are delusional. You see people with 5k+ hours, even 10k stating that "the game is bad" because there is no content. Bro...I don't have 10k hours in dota2 and I play it since 2013. There is a lot of content, and you have a certain freedom other MMO's don't provide.
There is no treadmill like WoW.

The devs make some mistakes but whatever, my server is packed, content everywhere and it looks/feels amazing. Play this game!

This game has definitely seen some improvements as of late. The push for cross platform compatibility has also improved some features that make the game, particularly combat systems, faster paced. The Linux support has always been phenomenal and it is clear they put serious effort into making the game compatible with the latest iterations of Proton that are included with Steam. I have had no issues playing on Arch, despite the "Silver" rating on ProtonDB. 

The gameplay, is great. Graphics are great. New storyline is leagues better than what they started with. Grinding tradeskills/gathering professions have been streamlined to be quite a bit faster (it will definitely still take a lot of time).

That said, $70 game that has had to be re-released in such a short time? The audacity of that is very strange, but if you get this on a Steam sale it is a great addition- especially for Linux users.

New World mérite sa chance ! 

De part sont histoire, certes se n'est pas un chefs d'oeuvre. Mais c'est très prenant et sa nous guide bien tous le long de notre aventure. On vois bien que amazon cherche à améliore cette partie du jeu, de part les multiple patch et mise à jour.

La sensation d'exploration, et de réel aventures ! De part toutes ses régions aussi unique soit-elle, avec leurs mini boss, leur paysage tous somptueux ! 

Les métiers sont réellement bien, et apporte beaucoup ! Quand on s'y intéresse on pourrais farm et cafter à l'infinie. Même si je l'accorde se n'est pas très intuitifs des le début.. Mais c'est un atout majeur dans New World.

En se qui concerne les armes, j'ai accroché sur maximum 3 arme, je trouve que sa manque un petit peux de diversité. Les armes sont toutes lambda au mmo classique, des dague, une arbalète, ou même une double épée aurais étais très sattisfaisant ! 

Une des chose qui me gave assez, c'est le béstaire, pas assez large.. On retrouve des Monstre du début d'aventure sur la fin avec 45 lv de + et un nom différent... c'est vraiment dommage.. Sa enleve un petit peux le sentiment de découverte dans certaine zone et on a vite envie de passez à autre chose.. 

Mais New World vaut le coup ! C'est au minima 250h de jeux  et je vous est pas compter le 100% qui doit bien compter le triple d'heur :o

Like many, I played New World at launch and have kept up with it's downfalls over the years. I stopped playing some time ago. BUT I will say, if you have played it in the past and haven't been back in awhile, take the chance. There are many games that make an amazing comeback after some rough years, and this IS one of them.

If you're choosing not to play based on negative reviews and the angry individuals that are hung up on the past, you will miss out on an awesome MMO. Just saying.

I've been an avid MMO player for 20 years. Played everything on the market that can even be considered an MMO. And even all the sandbox survival crafting, RPG, etc. New World feels fresh, and revamped. I normally get bored quick with things, this has kept me occupied like games used to years ago. Which is rare. The starting area takes a minute to get past before you really see the games potential. Make it past that and you will start to see everything unfold. 

Questing doesn't feel like a chore. They have combined elements from different genres in my opinion, to make it an MMO. But it works, and feels fluid. I'm excited to continue leveling and see where things take me. I am just sorry I didn't make it back to New World sooner! This will be my main squeeze for awhile, as I am bored out of my mind with WoW. 

I have no run into any bugs or lag whilst playing. Servers are refreshingly MORE populated than I had expected. Going into New World from a fresh perspective, I was worried all the negative Nacy's had scared away the player base, but it is definitely there. And the game doesn't feel dead at all. I've seen more people in the open world questing and farming to craft, than I do on my WoW servers. Here's to hoping New World continues to get a steady flow of new players, it's a whole new game and deserves some credit. 

I found a large Company / Guild that is friendly and actively doing end game content, that's very open to new players. I didn't expect that either. There's a nice community of people in this game.

Long story short, BUY the game and give it a fair and honest try. If you have played it when it was in it's darker years, TRY it again, it's well worth it now. 

Happy leveling, see you in New World!

Horrible compared to any other mmorpg in just about any metric. Price should be free to play with how much you need to purchase in their cash shop to make it almost feel like a real game. Hours played is just because of leaving the launcher on.

You need to pay money for features in any other game, the rest of the "features" are things noone ever wants in a mmorpg. 
Mount? You need to pay for it.
Transmog equipment? Pay for it. 
Emotes? Pay for it.
There's a very limited bank storage, but it's all stored in different banks across the map.
there's limited emotes, but you need to pay for them. 
Want xp boosts? you can pay for it.

You have a WEIGHT system in a mmorpg? nobody every wants that, this isn't a survival game.
Web interface systems for like maps, social panels, any gui, most fail to load randomly, or fail to accept your inputs.
Want to bind your respawn point? fails to load. 

Want skill variety? You get 3, with 15-35s cooldowns, you'll be left clicking more than in path of exile 1 (sorry Chris)
Graphics are about as good as elder scrolls online, where it somehow feels dated already, the environment is okay. and that's what saves it so far. 
There's no sub-classes, no skill variety, no class variety, no uniqueness to any of the classes, it feels like they intended for this to be a mobile game, and somehow failed to do that, but ported it to PC anyway. 

I think if you took elder scrolls dated graphics and somewhat action targeting system, removed all of it's mmorpg features aside from a character that could not even sprint and and no skills, combined it with Once Humans cash shop and hilarious attempt at "corruption", removed even it's poor attempt at an endgame you'd have New World. 

It feels like someone made a game, where every update has a meeting where the only direction is "how can we remove functions and features, and replace them in a way to make us money"

for a studio with an unlimited budget for features and ideas, this "game" is unacceptable

Comprei o jogo no lançamento, em 2021 e parei de jogar em 2022 (mais ou menos quando todo mundo parou e os servers esvaziaram). 
Reinstalei o jogo hoje (2025), para descobrir que é impossível jogá-lo atualmente sem comprar a expansão, que está 300 reais. 

Minha experiência de 3 anos atrás:

O early game é muito bom, graficos bonitos, movimentação, craft, tudo legal e envolvente.

As paisagens são bonitas, mas há pouca variedade em inimigos. Depois do level 40 você começa a reparar que o jogo fica repetitivo, e que os mesmos inimigos que você enfrentava lá no level 1 estão também nas áreas de level 40, 50, 60, com mais vida, mais dano, dificuldade maior. Esta pouca variedade em inimigos persiste até hoje, após 2 expansões, pelo que pude notar. 

O conteúdo end game em 2022 era sofrível. Havia um sistema de watermark que não convém explicar pois não existe mais (amém). 
O jogo estava infestado de bots coletores de recursos e bugs que estragavam completamente a economia do jogo. Dizem que isso melhorou. 
Os devs também não sabiam balancear as armas e armaduras. Eu abandonei o jogo em 2022 justamente por causa disso. Era ridículo entrar num campo de batalha 20x20 e notar que absolutamente TODOS os 40 jogadores estavam de armadura pesada e uma destas 3 armas: Machado, Martelo ou staff de healer (sim, o healer também usava armadura pesada). Estes setups não eram levemente superiores, mas obrigatórios. O guerreiro de machado com armadura pesada corria mais que arqueiro pelado, o dano dele era ridículo, e a redução de dano da armadura pesada era mais ridícula ainda. 

Vi comentários dizendo que o balanceamento do game melhorou com as atualizações, o que me fez reinstalar o jogo hoje (e desinstalar 30 minutos depois). 

A Amazon transformou as atualizações/expansões Angry Earth e Aetherum em conteúdos obrigatórios, e são caros. Ela matou o jogo para quem só tem o jogo base.
Você não é "obrigado" a comprar, mas se não comprar, não poderá passar do level 60. Dungeons que existiam no jogo base foram removidas. Itens bons só dropam em dungeons das expansões. Montarias e outras mecânicas não estão disponíveis para quem tem apenas o jogo base. As profissões só vão até lvl 200.

- Sem as expansões você não participa do PVP (talvez como saco de pancadas). 
- Sem as expansões você não entra em dungeons, está automaticamente excluído do conteúdo PVE também.
- Sem as expansões você não tem acesso a montaria.
-Sem as expansões você não participa da economia do game, pois não vai poder craftar nada além do lvl 200. 

Além disso os servers estão vazios, tem em torno de 800 pessoas jogando nos servidores da America do Sul divididos em 3 ou 4 servidores.  800 pessoas era o que tinha na fila para entrar no jogo em cada um dos em torno de 15 servidores quando lançou em 2021.

Em resumo:
O jogo é caro, precisa comprar a expansão que é cara, é repetitivo, poucos players ainda jogam, e a Amazon Games não é uma empresa confiável como produtora de games, tendo em vista que vende algo e remove conteúdo posteriormente. 
Eu estou excluído de um jogo que comprei no lançamento caso não compre a atualização, considero isso desrespeitoso.

I come from ESO and what interested me the most from the game was the combat. At the beginning if felt good but the more you play the more you realise combat is not that fluid. You cannot block-cast, cannot roll dodge cancel an ability, cannot bar swap at anytime. And all these things block you from not being hit by abilities (as much for pve than pvp) when you actually see them and press your buttons to block/dodge them. So you actually need to know your timings really well but when you do M3 expeditions you just get one shoted by everything if not a tank.

Mesmo muito tempo depois do lançamento, continua sendo um jogo com potencial imenso porém difícil de ser explorado. Para quem é imerso no PvP o late game de New World é sensacional, mas cansativo, e não traz recompensas equivalentes aos esforços dos jogadores. O PvE do jogo é satisfatório, normalmente feito em companhia de outros jogadores para terminar areas de elite espalhadas pelo mundo. Se você é um jogador solo, que gosta de explorar markets e farmar recursos, há também um espaço para você no jogo, utilizando de seus preciosos recursos para craftar itens valiosos para outros jogadores. Infelizmente, independente de  qual tipo de jogador você seja, além dos troféus, o jogo não possui itens extremamante desejáveis pela maioria dos playres em estágio final. A sensação é gastar horas e horas coletando moedas de modos diferentes, para no fim não ter onde gastar...

I will say this, the game combat is phenomenal. I have 2200 hours in this game for a reason. It's genuinely enjoyable when it comes to how the game plays. The PVP is exceptionally fun, the PVE is challenging in a way that I have not seen in other MMOs - especially tab target MMOs like EQ2 or WOW. However, the harshest criticism I would add is that there is a lack of new content in the game and the development team doesn't seem to understand what is wanted in an MMO. 

Seasonal servers are not the direction that we need to go moving forward. MMOs are about building the character you have and exploring new content annually. Adding the Hive of Gorgons was a great addition, but running the same content week after week becomes monotonous, especially when a lot of the content has been in the game for years. We need a few things in this game to make it great:

1. New Raid Dungeon each season. Seasons should introduce a new storyline, and new content for PVE. Right now, we don't have an engaging new addition to the storyline since Rise of the Angry Earth. This is needed to maintain gameplay.

2. We need a new overland zone. There is talking about the Dev team reworking Reekwater - which is nice, but at the same time, part of what makes me enjoy MMOs is that occasionally there is something new to explore. New storylines to uncover. New harvestables to go get. We have been missing that.

3. We badly need new expeditions and mutations. I love the expeditions in this game, they are well thought out (minus certain mechanics that are added purely to waste time - such as carrying the Azoth Staff half way across the map in Garden of Genesis and Starstone Barrows). Additionally, only allowing 3 mutation dungeons per week makes the game feel far too grindy. Like there are only 9 in the game, and yet each week I am limited to running the same three over and over and over which makes a game which is already small seem even smaller from a PVE standpoint.

3. We need new PVP maps - luckily there is another OPR being added, but we need new matches besides 3V3 and OPR. We need some new games like capture the flag.

4. The PVP zone in CK is an utter failure. It really adds very little to the game besides going to get your goldcursed coconut every Tuesday. A better method would be the PVP from Nagrand in WOW. Where every 4 hours somebody can take over a town. Then the three colors can fight for it every so often.

5. Storage needs to be consolidated and I should be able to manually organize things. It is so frustrating that each time I come back to my storage shed items are in a different order. Also the search bar at the top is annoying because if you type two letters, it makes me open different screens.

Make some quality of life changes, and add content, and this game would be wonderful. I would even pay a sub fee if it meant NEW CONTENT.

Bon je modifie mon avis extrème, le MMORPG New world Aeternum est un bon mmo qui a tout pour lui, métier, exploration quête, pvp, pve .. Les graphismes sont magnifiques et l'ambiance apocalyptique médiéval est super un MMO avec des zombies il fallait y penser c'est vraiment sympa comme jeu. Sérieusement on a l'impression d'être dans un Final fantasy online en monde ouvert, tout est beau les décor le ciel c'est très réussit. Un monde vivant ou on peut activer le pvp pour conquérir des zones c'est sympa!!
Je n'ai pas encore tout saisi des stuffs possibles et imaginables mais il y a l'air d'avoir pas mal de composition.
Par contre peu de sort on a trois sorts par armes et deux armes au choix, donc six sorts à choisir sur douze c'est très limité.. je n'ai aps encore testé le PVP je reviendrai rajouter des choses à mon commentaire..
Pour conclure c'est un bon MMORPG qui a tout les ingredients pour en faire un MMO aussi bien que wow ou guild wars 2, il est un sérieux concurrent par ses graphismes et son style unique de zombies médiéval. Des métiers qu'on monte en choisissant ceux qu'on veut monter un peu comme ALbion mais en 3D.
Je testerai le pvp pour voir ce que ça donne.
edit ! Les donjons parfait grosse difficulté quand on connait pas excellent je trouvais les autres mmo ennuyant à spamm nos sorts et rouler sur les donjons ici c'est plus compliqué mon premier donjon 60 j'ai galérer on est mort 3 fois au moins c'est un vrai RPG avec des boss épic et des victoires méritantes j'adore ce MMO !!!
Vraiment new world aeternum est le meilleur mmo du marché foncez !!!!
Par contre l'économie du jeu semble inutile on obtient nos équipements puissants en donjons on récupère énormément d'équipements et beaucoup sont liés au personnage gros point négatif du jeu selon moi, sur ALbion on peut tout vendre il y a un réel intérêt à avoir beaucoup de pièces que dans New world aucun intérêt on se stuff facilement en donjon et la plupart du temps on ne peut pas vendre nos équipements obtenus ou très peu cher on voit du stuff violet épique à 3 pièces d'argent c'est pas énorme.
Pareil le craft d'équipements les objets sont liés au personnage aucun intérêt..
ça tue l'économie.
Pareil le leveling est facile en suivant la quête principale et en faisant quelques donjons aléatoire en une semaine de jeu seulement j'ai up niveau max niveau 65.. Il faudrait rendre l'expérience plus compliquée comme un vrai RPG ou monter de niveau est significatif.. Je propose de monter le niveau maximum à 75 dans la prochaine extension mais sans l'xp 50% des donjons aléatoires. Que ce soit un vrai défis de monter de level en faisant des quêtes annexes partout etc. En augmentant un peu l'exp sur les monstres là New World Aeternum deviendra le MMORPG parfait

It feels like a nearly completed MMORPG. It plays like a single players RPG where the ending is nearly impossible to play unless you min max from the beginning. 

Pros - You can completely change "class" and respec on the cheap. Leveling to 0 - 60 is fairly quick. 

Cons - Most missions/quest feel the same. Items can only be sold at the player driven market. Upgrading equipment is expensive and requires PVP. End game content is lacking. I spent a lot of time waiting to get invited to the only raid where I could continue to develop my equipment. There is no reason to join a company. You are pretty much forced to join a faction. Very few players are willing to help with anything. 

Overall, there are other MMORPGs that do this same thing better.

Game play is unique but development is slow and poorly implemented (very buggy, forced content). The recent expansion sidelined 90% of all content (crafting, previous rewards and events) in favour of one bug-filled dungeon for best-in-slot gear. By the way, that dungeon is gate-kept by sweaty players in-game who make it a horrible experience to run.
As far PvP is concerned, as soon as any build gets popular for casual gamers it gets nerfed into the ground (Amazon Game Studios seem to have an aversion to any fun being detected).
Its new and robust it actually has a premise and invites a level of character to the game that was lacking before.
