I played the beta before launch and then, of course, played on launch. The game had so much promise. The combat is player controlled vs combat like WoW where it's a race to mash the most buttons. The diversity in weapons was cool and I enjoyed the PvE and PvP combat. The Companies was a great idea with being able to conquer territory through PvP events, declaring war on other factions, and setting taxes and fees on crafting and refining to fund the Companies. I thoroughly enjoyed that. It gave the Companies purpose instead of just being a purely cosmetic social hub like most other MMO's, even if it makes it easier to group for raids and dungeons.

The main story was alright at first, then they introduced a more in-depth campaign with more cutscenes and cinematics to drive the narrative and make it more immersive. I thought that was a good improvement. I also thought more waypoints to fast travel was a good quality of life update.

The crafting system is one I like. I've dropped this game and picked up primarily for the aesthetic of the PvE and the crafting. It hits the spot in ways other MMO's don't. They made some updates to where you don't really have professions that fall behind. Wood gathering was one that started off the most annoying as it was the slowest grind. You could deforest a whole zone and it would only give maybe half a dozen levels. Meanwhile, your other gathering skills are double, if not triple, that of wood gathering.

What became an obvious faltering point was endgame content. It was severely lacking. There were the two high-level zones, but there wasn't much to do other than the respective dungeons and grind for the mats to craft legendary gear that didn't really mean much since it wasn't necessary to grind in the high-level zones. Eventually, there was more content added, but endgame content being overlooked like that is something that can kill a game as it's supposed to make a difference on how the entire leveling process and playstyle is conducted, whether it be PvE or PvP.

The part that makes me dislike the game is the fact that the devs blocked off First Light, then paywalled it as a "DLC", throwing in a mount and new weapon. Even though it's only one zone, the devs have orchestrated it to where OG players had to buy it twice. I have yet to do so and a mount and new weapon isn't enough to entice me to buy that zone a second time. I paid for it once when I bought the game. I'm not buying it again.

What shows that this game isn't doing as well as AGS likes to believe is that they've had to do numerous server merges as there haven't been enough players to justify the number of servers they first had. To go from what many called "queue simulator" because the servers were bloated to multiple consolidations shows just how far the game fell. Then they rereleased the game when they made it available for consoles, adding a subtitle like it made a difference. All it did was wipe the mixed reviews from the first iteration. Rather than permitting the deception, the players carried the reviews over as to maintain honesty.

Despite the features, mechanics, and concepts that I like, I do not recommend this game. What I personally enjoy isn't enough to endorse the game in its entirety. I'd be doing a disservice to the developers by saying this game is worth spending money on in its current state. We need better quality games, not rebranded mediocrity. I'll probably play it in small increments, but other MMO's scratch the overall MMO itch better than New World ever will at this point. It's a shame. This game had so much potential. I foresee that unless a massive expansion with a rework or a sequel comes out that addresses and fixes what went wrong with this game, it won't be long before they're forced to stop supporting it. With only a handful of servers left, it's seems like an inevitability.

Their lack of competence in addressing long-standing problems is frustrating, and instead of improving the experience, they make it worse.

If you're thinking about buying this game, DON'T. You'll only be met with disappointment as Amazon fails time and time again to manage and support it properly. What could have been a fantastic MMORPG is now a frustrating mess, and it’s clear that the developers have no idea how to handle it. Save your time and money.

[h3]New World: Aeternum – Eine Schönheit mit Schwächen im Detail[/h3]

[b]Grafik und Atmosphäre:[/b] 
Aeternum ist eine Augenweide. Die detailreichen Wälder, dichten Nebelschwaden und das stimmige Lichtspiel sorgen für eine der immersivsten Welten in einem MMO. Das Gefühl, durch dschungelartige Ruinen oder schneebedeckte Berge zu streifen, ist unvergleichlich.

[b]Gameplay: [/b]
Das actionorientierte Kampfsystem bietet ein angenehmes Gefühl, aber die geringe Anzahl an Fähigkeiten pro Waffe begrenzt die taktische Tiefe. Das Handwerkssystem ist umfangreich, aber der Grind – insbesondere bei Rohstoffen höherer Stufen – kann schnell monoton werden.

[b]PvP und Kriege:[/b] 
Die Massenschlachten um Territorien sind ein Highlight, allerdings von Performance-Problemen und unzureichendem Balancing geplagt. Die Dominanz größerer Gilden schränkt kleinere Spielergruppen oft ein.

[b]Endgame:[/b] 
Hier liegt das größte Problem: Nach Level 60 fehlt es an motivierenden Inhalten. Die Dungeon-Mechaniken sind interessant, aber der Fokus auf Grinding und sich wiederholende Expeditionen fühlt sich uninspiriert an.

[b]Mein Fazit:[/b] 
New World ist eine visuell beeindruckende Reise in eine einzigartige Welt, die jedoch unter wiederholenden Inhalten, unausgereiftem Endgame, schlechtem Balancing und technischen Schwächen leidet. Es bietet starke Momente – vor allem in der Erkundung und im PvP – verliert jedoch schnell an Reiz, wenn die anfängliche Faszination der Welt verblasst.Es ist ein Erlebnis, das eher visuell als spielerisch glänzt.

I don't think Amazon understands what's wrong with this game. I understand the season worlds but the leveling up to 65 is WAY too fast for an MMO. You shouldn't be able to play for two to three days and then be able to experience all of the content in an MMO. Now with seasonal worlds, you can play through the same story, but just faster? The first play through of this game is amazing, I will not lie. Amazon has done an amazing job and ensuring that there is zero replay-ability. Sure you can do it, but why? You don't gain anything new. You don't gain access to anything new. You use the same weapons. It's boring after the first 50-60 hours. Once you hit max level in this game, it just kinda stops for a semi casual player. Grinding skills doesn't feel good, it feels pointless. I honestly can't believe how much fun this game was week 1, just for them to fumble the rest of it. The game is not worth $60. My response to those complaints, is if its a big issue for you go play call of duty with a controller then log back in.... 

Any other review past a bug complaint or "lame cash grab scheme making us pay for mounts when newbies get it for free", is complete sillyness, if you had any brain, you would remember that originally the game (when it came out) was around 30-40 dollars. You'd have to be a complete moron to not notice that the base game has now changed from that price to now the whopping $60. It's Amazon, so I ignored it to begin with. Then a friend showed me what the gameplay was like and I gave it a try and I am sold.

The best bits:
- there are no restrictions on which professions; you can learn them all.
- class isn't tied to an individual character - if you want to play a different class, it's locked behind a new weapon and a respec
- the world is beautiful

The not so good bits:
- the key bindings feel a little awkward and non-intuitive

Bear in mind this is after just 24ish hours of nothing but harvesting and crafting. I haven't progressed too much past the initial quests... But also, that's 24ish hours of nothing but harvesting and crafting and I am not bored yet.

Play on, lads.

So far, I’m really enjoying New World. The world feels massive and beautifully crafted, with a lot of creativity in the design—it’s hard not to get drawn into the stunning landscapes and unique details in each region. The faction system is a great touch too; it makes you feel like you’re part of something bigger, and seeing your efforts contribute to its growth is really satisfying. I’m also impressed by the crafting—it’s so well-designed that it feels like a natural part of the game rather than a grind. There’s so much thought and creativity packed into this game, and I can’t wait to see how it evolves!

I bought the game last Christmas (almost a month ago), and I've already put over 240 hours into my character. The game is extremely fun. I honestly don't get the bad reviews. I'm having a blast!

The leveling experience is perfect. Not too much of a grind, but not super fast either. There's plenty of stuff to discover while leveling. The mount system is very well made. Crafting is incredible. You can gather almost everything you see around you. The environment is truly beautiful, and the music is also great. The immersion is there. Player housing is a cool part of the game as well. Combat is fun, modern and satisfying. Being able to swap your "class" by changing your weapon is awesome. Dungeon design and boss fights are truly incredible. Mutated dungeons are no joke, but the rewards are worth it. The story is decent enough to keep you interested, but it could be better. I skipped most dialogs but I enjoyed the cutscenes alot. Gearing up, finding upgrades and working on your artifacts and BiS is a fun process. The season pass is also fun to complete, with the "bingo card" mechanic. PvP is fine, but I'm bad at it so I can't really comment.

Of course, the game is not perfect. But, with all the bug fixes and stuff that arrived with Season 7, plus the roadmap for 2025, I'm confident that the game is gonna get even better.

I truly recommend it, but I would probably buy it on sale. The regular price is expensive.

It is one of the few games like Black Desert Online or Eve Online that allow you to literally waste a day just life skilling or questing or dungeoneering. Your level is the only thing that limits you. What I see in the reviews are gamers that want everything handed to them or don't want to pay money for a game and DLC. It's a good game. So far I have over 400 hours in it and have not been bored once. But this is my opinion and I enjoy a game with tons of stuff to do. I don't care for games where you smash one button until you win and everything is easy. Which, in my opinion based on the reviews, is what gamers want now. Maybe I'm too old and don't mind earning things.

1. Graphismes et direction artistique
New World: Aeternum propose des graphismes époustouflants qui exploitent pleinement les capacités des machines modernes. Les environnements sont détaillés et immersifs, avec des effets de lumière et d’ombres particulièrement impressionnants. Les paysages de l’île d’Aeternum sont variés, allant des forêts luxuriantes aux montagnes enneigées en passant par des ruines mystérieuses. Cependant, ce niveau de détail a un prix : sur un PC gaming datant de 10 ans, le jeu est tout simplement injouable, même avec les paramètres graphiques au minimum.

2. Gameplay et mécanique de jeu
Le gameplay de New World se concentre sur un mélange d’exploration, de combat en temps réel et d’artisanat. Le système de combat, qui repose sur des compétences actives et une gestion précise des esquives et des attaques, est à la fois dynamique et satisfaisant. Les joueurs peuvent choisir parmi une variété de styles de jeu grâce à des armes comme les épées, les arcs et les bâtons magiques.

L’artisanat est particulièrement bien développé, avec un système complexe qui récompense la collecte et la création d’équipements. Les factions et les batailles de territoire ajoutent une dimension compétitive et sociale intéressante. Toutefois, la répétitivité des quêtes et le grind nécessaire pour progresser peuvent devenir lassants à la longue.

3. Histoire et narration
Le jeu propose une intrigue centrée sur l’île mystérieuse d’Aeternum, où des forces surnaturelles et des secrets anciens attendent d’être découverts. Bien que l’histoire principale offre quelques moments captivants, elle manque parfois de profondeur et de personnages marquants. Les quêtes secondaires sont souvent génériques, se limitant à des tâches classiques comme éliminer des ennemis ou collecter des objets.

4. Bande-son et ambiance sonore
La bande-son de New World est immersive, avec des compositions orchestrales qui renforcent l’ambiance mystérieuse et épique d’Aeternum. Les bruitages environnementaux, comme le vent dans les arbres ou le cliquetis des armes, contribuent à l’immersion. Cependant, le doublage des personnages est minimal, ce qui peut diminuer l’impact narratif pour certains joueurs.

5. Durée de vie et rejouabilité
New World offre une durée de vie impressionnante, grâce à son monde ouvert vaste et à ses activités variées, comme l’artisanat, les batailles de territoire et les expéditions. Les joueurs investis dans les aspects multijoueurs, comme les guerres entre factions ou le commerce, trouveront beaucoup de raisons de rester engagés. Cependant, pour les joueurs plus occasionnels, la nature répétitive du contenu pourrait limiter l’attrait à long terme.

6. Points positifs
Graphismes magnifiques et direction artistique immersive.
Système de combat dynamique et satisfaisant.
Artisanat et économie bien développés.
Batailles de territoire compétitives et engageantes.

7. Points négatifs
Requiert un PC puissant : injouable sur une machine datant de 10 ans.
Quêtes répétitives et grind intensif.
Histoire principale et personnages manquant de profondeur.
Difficulté à équilibrer les factions, ce qui peut frustrer les joueurs.

Conclusion
New World: Aeternum est un MMORPG ambitieux qui brille par ses graphismes impressionnants, son gameplay dynamique et ses nombreuses activités sociales et compétitives. Cependant, ses exigences matérielles élevées le rendent inaccessible pour les joueurs disposant d’un PC plus ancien, et sa répétitivité pourrait décourager certains. Pour les amateurs de MMORPG avec une machine récente, le jeu offre une expérience riche et immersive, bien qu’imparfaite.

New World is a game that sparks both admiration and frustration in equal measure. On the one hand, it showcases some of the most impressive technical achievements in the MMO genre. Its engine is nothing short of outstanding, delivering breathtaking visuals, seamless landscapes, and immersive environments. The combat system, without a doubt, is the best I've ever experienced—fluid, engaging, and brimming with potential to redefine action-based MMO gameplay.
But here's the kicker: the brilliance of New World is being systematically sabotaged by its own leadership, particularly Game Director Scot Lane. This man seems utterly clueless about what he's doing. For years, the community has been voicing the same issues and offering clear feedback. And what does Scot do? He insists he knows better, leading the game deeper into a quagmire of poor decisions.
Let’s talk specifics:
1.	PvP Content: There’s only one Outpost Rush (OPR) map and two arena maps—and it’s been like this for years. The matchmaking for PvP modes is horrible you wait way to long for a quick match with randoms. There should be a FFA mode or Team Deathmatch etc.
2.	Story Mode: The story has been reworked multiple times, leaving players to slog through revamped content that lacks coherence or excitement. The recent 40GB update is the worst offender yet, introducing a disastrous PvP server concept that defies logic and alienates the community.
3.	Incompetence on Display: Upon the release of the latest update (21.01.25), players were logging out in droves right after completing the tutorial. Why? Because no one wants to relive the same rehashed story year after year. Scot Lane’s grand vision for New World is complete garbage—an absolute train wreck of wasted potential.
The community is unanimously disappointed. No one I know has anything positive to say about the developers, and this speaks volumes about the leadership. New World could have been the perfect MMO, but under Scot Lane’s direction, it’s spiraling toward its grave.
Amazon Games, it’s time to wake up. Either fire this man or prepare to bury New World for good. This update might very well be the final nail in the coffin.
Final Verdict: A flawed masterpiece held hostage by poor leadership. Save yourself the frustration unless drastic changes are made.

We split ways since I was in a different faction, our friendship had ended after many long, difficult adventures and days of fetch quests with a dash of action with an occasional low rank creature and a  wonderful advancement rate of roughly 30 levels. Within a fortnight conflict between my faction and theirs erupts in a nearby settlement. I naturally heeded the call to action and fought alongside my fellow purple in this struggle against the green. I felt invincible. I stray off to find more prey while we trample the green greenery in front of us.that's when I saw him across the field, he appeared level-headed and brandishing the renowned baller ass bow I had given him as a gift from master to student. A skirmish breaks out; arrows fly, and my magic deals damage. I use my void strikes to suck his life away while he rains arrows upon my head. Defeated, my student slaughtered me with the bow I supplied him, while I lay dying, cold and alone, bested by my student, my friend. He looks over at me and gives me the "thumbs up" emoticon before running off to kill more of my new pals. 10/10 would recommend.

Seriously, New World? So you’re telling me that because I didn’t log in for a while, you decided to mark my account as “latent” and straight-up gave my character names away? No heads-up, no warning email—nothing. I log in today, excited to play, only to be hit with “This character name has been taken by another player.”

And now I’m forced to rename my characters, even though I’ve had these names since launch and hit max level? I find out this is some new policy where inactive accounts lose their names, and I’m just supposed to accept it? Not cool.

This is the only MMO I’ve ever played that straight-up takes your name away if you’re inactive. Every other game I’ve played respects their players enough to preserve their usernames, no matter how long they’re gone. My progress and items might still be there, but what’s the point if I don’t even feel like it’s my character anymore?

You could’ve at least given me a chance to reclaim my names before handing them out to someone else. This whole forced renaming thing is frustrating beyond words and feels like a slap in the face to long-time players. Honestly, it makes me not want to play at all.

New World: Aeternum is like moving to a magical island paradise where everything wants to kill you, and you spend 90% of your time questioning your life choices. At first glance, it’s stunning—lush forests, sparkling rivers, and epic mountains. But once you start playing, you realize you’re here for one thing and one thing only: grinding.  

Let’s talk about the crafting system. Oh boy. You want to make pants? Hope you’re ready to spend an entire week gathering materials just to sew together some ugly trousers that you’ll never wear because the stats are garbage. And don’t even get me started on all the random stuff you have to craft just to level up your skills—99% of it goes straight into the scrap pile. It’s like they turned a survival game into a full-time job, and the paycheck is disappointment.  

And then there’s the endgame content, which feels like Minecraft and Skyrim had a baby, but it inherited all the grind and none of the charm. Sure, there’s stuff to do—side quests, farming, and building—but the loot? Meh. After hours of slogging through endless farming and fighting, you finally get a shiny new item... that’s slightly better than the garbage you were already using. Woohoo.  

The PvP is fun if you’re into faction wars and smacking strangers with a giant hammer, but it doesn’t do much to distract from the repetitive grind. And the side quests? Let’s just say they involve a lot of killing the same mobs and picking up shiny things like a very violent Easter egg hunt.  

New World isn’t a *bad* game—it’s just a game that demands an unreasonable amount of your time and rewards you with a shrug. If you love grinding, crafting, and farming until your soul leaves your body, then Aeternum’s got your name on it. But for the rest of us? Maybe just visit the pretty landscapes and call it a day. 6.5/10, would chop wood and regret it again.

Excelente jogo, excelente combate, excelente PvP.

O problema das filas acabou três dias após o lançamento. Hoje posso afirmar que você não enfrentará fila nenhuma, até porque, quem ainda não parou de jogar é porque realmente gostou do jogo. Estou completando um mês de jogo e jogando todos os dias, e não tenho do que reclamar. "Ah, mas o jogo tá cheio de bugs". Me aponte um jogo perfeito, sem bugs. WoW, BDO, entre outros, até hoje têm bugs que estão longe de serem completamente corrigidos. Estarei à sua espera!

É o único jogo, depois de MU, que me faz passar horas jogando. Jogo com tudo no "alto" e os gráficos ficam surpreendentes. Várias áreas focam na natureza de forma absurdamente linda. O sistema de PvP é super divertido, e o sistema de armas e itens é muito complexo e bem feito (com rumores de melhorar ainda mais). A alta chance é de ser um jogo que dificilmente será abandonado, pois a Amazon vai continuar investindo no game. Porém, é claramente indicado para jogadores que gostam de jogos massivos, de upar serviços, armas, habilidades, entre outros além do nível do personagem.

O jogo é extremamente viciante. A melhor parte é que tudo que você faz ganha experiência de nível e não apenas matando monstros. Cada coisa no mundo tem uma habilidade diferente que vai upando. Dá para comprar casas para ajudar no teleporte, e cada arma que você coloca na mão define a classe que vai usar. Você pode resetar os pontos de habilidade e de atributos quando quiser gratuitamente até certo nível, e depois custa pouco dinheiro ou Azoth. Os servidores foram trancados para novas contas para que os jogadores não enfrentassem filas e fossem distribuídos em todos, e agora já estão liberados novamente. Não recomendo jogar com tudo no máximo, pois aquece demais a placa de vídeo, e se diminuir quase não faz diferença no gráfico. Dá para deixar só a textura alta. Enfim, merece 10 estrelas!

Os servidores já foram normalizados, quanto à questão das filas. O jogo é maravilhoso, imersivo demais ao ponto de você esquecer do restante do mundo, da hora, e te colocar diretamente dentro do jogo literalmente.

Gráficos perfeitos! Os efeitos sonoros então... sem comentários, só testem!!!

Comprem com certeza, vale muito a pena!!!

Look there are a ton of split opinions on this game and honestly both sides have valid points. I personally love this game and have played it sense the beta test, but it may not be for everyone. 

Now to address some things, yes the game has micro transactions however they are not pay to win, they are mainly skins and cosmetic items, the only slight boost that you can pay for is to unlock premium rewards during season events, when I say "slight boost" I mean you get some better, cooler crafting supplies and extra cosmetics form the premium season event rewards, to note the crafting supplies you get from the premium pass can be obtained by anyone as long as their crafting levels are high enough (it is just extra that you don't need to spend mats to make). As for the lore that really just falls under personal opinion, I personally like it because its unique and interesting due to it including a few cool cultures from history and being set in what i think is the late 1600s, however I can also see a lot of people finding it boring and bland so there is that to consider if your thinking of buying it for the RP. Now for the grinding aspect of this game, I personally think its fine and really quite addicting, I have heard people complain a lot about the amount of time and grinding it takes to reach max levels but looking at it from a gamer perspective what mmorpgs don't take a lot of grinding and time to fully level up crafting skills, I will say tho if grinding is not something you enjoy and it is something you actively despise don't buy this game because there is definitely a lot of it.

The game itself has plenty to do between main quests, side quests, pvp, faction pvp, dungeons, crafting, exploring, world bosses, special events and mat grinding so it is hard to get bored. One of the things I find nice about the game is you can really decide what you want to do day by day and are not forced to do one thing or the other. As for pvp it can be really fun and interactive, I don't personally play the pvp aspect of the game very much but when I do I really enjoy it. One of the most interesting aspects of the game to me is the faction pvp as it adds game politics which in itself is an interesting thing to watch.

One last thing to note before buying this game is if you are hoping its a modern WOW you might as well not buy the game, they are both great games but have completely different mechanics, visions, game play and ideas behind them so trying to compare the two is pointless. I do however recommend this game to people that enjoy mmorpgs as it is one of the best modern mmorpgs that I have found.

I was late to the game, as it were, but still pleasantly-surprised. Most of the friends I had were already "done" with it by the time I decided to give it a chance, so I started alone - like most people probably do. I think that this helped to highlight New World's strength as a solo-friendly MMO, and encouraged me to "be social" with my fellow players, though this wasn't overly-necessary.

Finding groups for some of the lowbie dungeon content was hard at times, but while the dungeons are pretty fun, they're neither necessary nor (from my experience) particularly a highlight of the game.

es un juego con mucho potencial en el que la habilidad como jugador lo es todo. les dejo mis puntos de vista para el que quiera leer , tengo 3400 horas de juego y juego desde su inicio dejándolo varias veces .

PVE : para los jugadores a los que les gusta mucho el pve  , farmeo de materiales y jugar al comercio tienen contenido de sobra por que hay tantas cosas para farmear y vender  y el mapa es gigantesco con muchos recursos.
también hay instancias de 5 / 10 / 20 personas con cierta dificultad en el que hay que matar boss sincronizando con las demas personas 

COMUNIDAD :  a los jugadores que les gusta pertenecer a una comunidad  y hacer amigos podran encontrar eso en las companias(clanes) o faccion  en la que se forman vinculos de amistad en donde se habla por horas en discord hasta la noche todos los dias. 

PVP : y a los jugadores enfocados en el pvp que es lo que mas me gusta,  el sistema de combate es muy bueno en el que todas las armas sirven y puedes usar diferentes combinaciones donde demuestras tu nivel de habilidad  y competitividad. tiene varios modos de contenido como arenas 3 vs 3 /  outpost 20 vs 20 / guerras 50 vs 50(companias/clanes)  y pvp open world en donde puedes ir solo o con amigos ademas una isla en el que es pvp todos contra todos con ciertas recompensas en el que matar a alguien en un combate difícil te da una gran satisfacción  especialmente si te haces 1 vs varios.
la mayoría de los jugadores que juegan al pvp son muy competitivos y se arman muchas rivalidades  y odio en la que la mayoría de las veces  se termina en amistad ya que comparten el gusto por el pvp♥ 
también hay un ranking pvp / outpost / arena por si te gusta estar entre los mejores.

les recomiendo que les den una oportunidad a este gran juego en el que si bien tuvieron muchas fallas horribles, mal enfoque y muchas cosas desmotivantes que hacían que cada vez mas gente deje de jugar(me incluyo), aun así no se han rendido y han pulido cada vez mas el juego y aprendido de sus errores  siguiendo adelante con el paso de los años .
no se dejen guiar por comentarios o reseñas de gente que solo ha jugado en sus inicios y paso por un disgusto criticando el juego sin parar y sin volverlo a probar o llegar a su end game (ser lvl max no es end game)  no se dejen influir por personas negativas  que van de un juego a otro criticando todo.

y una cosa negativa  de destacar que tiene actualmente es su elevado precio que no da oportunidad a mucha gente de probarlo 
si bajaran su precio mas gente se animaría a probarlo.
pesimo, cada vez que entro pega bajones de fps de 75 a 10 o menos, luego de un rato asi se desconecta solo.
buen juego la actulizacion lo mejor mucho nuevas zonas nuevo equipo buen contenido,

New World: Aeternum'da Kaybolmaya Hazır Olun!

New World,  keşfetme, savaş ve crafting deneyimini mükemmel bir şekilde birleştiren bir MMORPG şaheseri. Aeternum adası büyüleyici olduğu kadar tehlikeli ve her anında ayrı bir heyecan sunuyor.

Artıları:

Büyüleyici Dünya: Aeternum’un doğal güzellikleri, detaylı çevre tasarımı ve mistik havası oyuncuyu içine çekiyor. Kendimi her köşeyi keşfetmek isterken buldum.
Savaş Mekanikleri: Dinamik ve yetenek tabanlı savaş sistemi, aksiyonu oldukça tatmin edici hale getiriyor. Farklı silahlar ve beceri kombinasyonlarıyla oynayış tarzınızı belirlemek çok keyifli.
Topluluk ve PvP: Fraksiyon savaşları ve açık dünya PvP etkinlikleri, oyuncular arası etkileşimi oldukça heyecanlı hale getiriyor.
Crafting ve Ekonomi: Kaynak toplamak, eşyalar üretmek ve ticaret yapmak başlı başına bağımlılık yapıcı bir deneyim. Ekonomi sisteminin derinliği etkileyici.
Geliştirici Desteği: Oyuncu geri bildirimlerine duyarlı bir ekip tarafından sürekli güncellenen ve geliştirilen bir oyun.
Eksileri:

Başlangıçta görev sistemi biraz tekrara düşebiliyor, ancak ilerledikçe daha çeşitli içeriklere ulaşıyorsunuz.
Eğer bir MMORPG hayranıysanız, Aeternum’da saatlerinizi keyifle harcayacağınıza eminim. Oyun sürekli gelişiyor ve gelecekte daha da iyi olacağından hiç şüphem yok. Arkadaşlarınızla ya da tek başınıza oynarken bu dünyada kaybolmaya hazır olun! 🌍⚔️

👉 Oynama Sürem: 82 Saat
👑 Tavsiye Ediyor muyum? Kesinlikle evet!

Puanım: 8.5/10
Aeternum’un gizemli dünyası sizi bekliyor – maceranıza bugün başlayın! 🌟

I'll make a list

- I can just keep going, but I'm bored now. I'll keep bitching about this game in April.

É um jogo bem divertido, porém o preço ta bem salgado. Comprei basicamente no lançamento, joguei um bom tempo e voltei agora recentemente para ver os "Reworking" que fizeram para o Aeternum.

Teve muitas mudanças do antes para agora?
Não, para 3 anos sem jogar os conteúdos novos não foram tão inovadores.

Vale a pena comprar?

O sistema de combate é legal, tem grande variedade de armas e combinações (que não é la tão original) mas é da hora, O sistema de profissões é divertido, não é lá o mais gratificante, tipo coleta coisa pra caraleo, upa no talo, ganha uma conquista e faz umas moedas com os itens, nada de mais. A história do jogo e lore são interessantes, mas também nada tão original, Bem e Mal conflito, guerra, bla bla bla..

A expansão vale a pena?
Se tiver com um desconto de 90%, ai sim. Comprei no preço original, e olha basicamente 100,00 pra ter uma montaria, o que la em 2021 não tinha e era tipo fazer algo em 10min e caminhar 20min pra entregar uma quest. Era New World: Walking Simulator.

Com esse preço, não vale a pena. Paguei 32 reais na época e depois chorei pra pagar 70 reais na expansão. E o que muda com ou sem expansão? Nada! Pegaram conteúdo que deveria já existir no jogo base e colocaram na expansão como se fossem "novidades". Até entendo adicionar novas áreas e tal, mas é uma expansão porca, com pouco conteúdo.

Achei divertido, especialmente pelo sistema de combate, que é empolgante. As partes mais divertidas foram as lutas contra monstros gigantes ou mobs espalhados pelo mapa. As Dungeons (DGs) também são boas.

A lifeskill tem uma ideia interessante, mas é muito fácil: qualquer um pode fazer qualquer coisa e maximizar habilidades. As áreas que demoram mais pra upar são crafting, isso é claro se você coletar os seus próprios recursos, se for comprar, é bem rápido. Porém, mesmo assim, as recompensas são insignificantes, servindo apenas para dar ao jogador aquela sensação de "fiz o que tinha que fazer hoje" e motivá-lo a voltar no dia seguinte.

A ideia do jogo é muito boa, assim como o combate. Entretanto, a execução parece ter sido feita por um grupo de programadores amadores, sem alguém para gerenciar o projeto de forma adequada. Não estou desmerecendo esses grupos, até porque já tivemos muitos jogos incríveis feitos por estúdios pequenos ou até por uma única pessoa.
No caso de New World, é simplesmente descaso da empresa com o consumidor.

O maior problema do jogo é a otimização. Para um jogo com gráficos datados, é um absurdo a falta de cuidado. Quem acha que esses gráficos são de última geração está sendo clubista. O jogo já nasceu com gráficos medianos para a época, nada especial.

Mesmo assim, ele é extremamente mal otimizado. Não faz sentido precisar de um computador de 20 mil reais para jogar New World, muito menos para rodar tranquilamente. Um PC de 3 mil reais já deveria ser suficiente para esse jogo!


NÃO comprem por esse preço abusivo só porque o jogo foi renomeado para "New World: Aeternum".
Não vale nem um pouco a pena!

New World est une véritable bouffée d’air frais dans l’univers des MMORPG, offrant une expérience immersive et captivante qui ne cesse de surprendre. Amazon Games a brillamment réussi à créer un monde ouvert vaste et vivant, où chaque recoin de l’île d’Aeternum déborde de mystères, de dangers et d’opportunités.

Graphiquement, New World est une claque visuelle. Les environnements sont sublimes et variés, passant de forêts denses baignées de lumière à des marais inquiétants et des ruines anciennes mystérieuses. L’attention portée aux détails donne une réelle impression d’immersion. Le cycle jour/nuit et les effets météorologiques dynamiques renforcent cette sensation d’un monde en perpétuelle évolution.

Le gameplay est fluide et dynamique. Le système de combat en temps réel, sans ciblage automatique, donne une véritable sensation de contrôle. Chaque coup porté, chaque esquive et chaque blocage demandent précision et réactivité. Ce choix rend les affrontements bien plus engageants que dans de nombreux MMORPG classiques. La variété des armes et des styles de combat permet à chacun de façonner son propre style de jeu, sans être enfermé dans des classes figées.

L’économie dirigée par les joueurs est un pilier central de New World. La récolte de ressources, l’artisanat et le commerce sont extrêmement bien intégrés, créant un écosystème vivant où chaque métier a son importance. L’évolution des villes grâce aux efforts des joueurs apporte un sentiment de progression collective unique.

Les guerres de territoires entre factions ajoutent une dimension stratégique et compétitive passionnante. Conquérir, défendre et gérer des territoires implique coopération et stratégie, donnant un vrai poids aux actions des guildes. Ce système PvP massivement multijoueur est l’un des plus réussis du genre, offrant des batailles épiques et mémorables.

Même l’exploration pure est gratifiante. L’île regorge de secrets, de donjons et d’événements dynamiques. Chaque sortie dans la nature peut mener à des découvertes inattendues, des combats intenses ou des alliances opportunes.

En résumé, New World est une réussite qui combine action, stratégie, coopération et exploration dans un univers immersif et somptueux. Amazon Games a su poser les bases solides d’un MMORPG moderne, tout en innovant avec des mécaniques engageantes. Un monde où chaque joueur peut véritablement laisser son empreinte. Un incontournable pour tous les amateurs d’aventure et de conquête.

As a jaded mmo player who is still stuck on memories of vanilla Wow, NW has rekindled my passion for mmo gaming. It has improved alot of its systems and more. Better performance, better story/dialogue/characters, a lot more to do both pve and PvP wise. Even the terrain is fun to jump and climb on, where it turns into a game of super Mario and parkour. However, It is grindy, and this is a hit or miss for players. But it isn’t like some games where there’s nothing to do at end game…there is plenty to do. It’s one of those games where it’s ok to take it slow, like RuneScape for example. The gear balance is decent for an mmo, unlike some where getting the best gear really puts you leagues above others. To get best in socket gear depends on what you’re trying to do. I’ve managed to get to a respectable gear level despite 95 hours as I write this review, being able to do content and stay on par with players. 

The community is lively and people talk to each other, especially with the feature of VOIP talking in game. hearing someone talk on the mic in town is funny sometimes and adds life to the world, especially when many MMOs suffer from the curse of toxicity or no interactions. The game has alot of sweats but it’s not as bad as some other games. But you also have alot of casuals as well, as the community seems to be a bit more emotionally intelligent…maybe not super happy and rainbows like FFXIV but better than others.  I’ve found the community to be gamers averaging around 30 years old, although there are some younger gamers present as well.

On one hand, all the systems smoothly integrate into each other. Crafting has many purposes unlike some MMOs where it becomes an afterthought. There’s a good balance of both pve and PvP with an emphasis on PvP. The territory control mechanics are alright compared to some other MMOs I played (throne liberty, mortal online, etc)…while gate keeping is a common problem in these open world PvP type games, it’s implemented here in a way where you don’t have that issue and many servers have a good balance of healthy PvP. PvP is optional if you wanna keep your flag off but there are some areas where it gets turned on…those are end game areas. It’s not punishing too much if you do die, unlike some other PvP loot MMOs that are very unforgiving and you lose all your stuff…because let’s be honest, no one likes their time wasted. I

The combat is some of the most fun I’ve had in a mmo. I’ve phased out a bit from tab targeting and NW makes combat more engaging due to its real time action rpg elements.  You can turn the game into a dark souls game as a melee player or a fps 3rd person shooter if you have the bow musket or blunderbuss…healing is more fun in this game than other MMOs too. 

There’s so much customization in builds you can do and all the weapons are pretty balanced, although there are some obvious combinations that are very strong…you can make anything work technically depending on if you do pve PvP or both. I’ve spent alot of time theory crafting and it’s honestly one of my favorite parts of the game. You don’t have to min max with the meta builds but it is good to still know what they are so you don’t get too weird with your build and you’re wondering why it doesn’t work in some areas of content. I would recommend finding a guild or friends and running content that way so you don’t fall into pugging with randoms and being succumbed to the usual link gear, gatekeeping aspects. Choose your play style.

Getting to max level doesn’t take too long (less than a week if you’re fast). But even the leveling isn’t a bad experience, as exploring the world, climbing mountains and finding all kinds of things is quite interesting.

The story and voice acting is pretty good. It’s your typical mmo lore but it does have its own flavor and uniqueness being in a 1700s fantasy theme, which is unique.

If you have a good pc system, the graphics are breathtaking.  It looks pretty good on console too. 

There’s also a roadmap now so the game is doing pretty well. AGS managed to turn the game around with releasing it to console and fixing many systems.

There’s a cash shop and some ways to speed up certain processes but definitely not pay to win, although it can get expensive for skins. The game has good default skins so you don’t necessarily have to use the cash shop. AGS has to support the game somehow, right? You can do everything free if you wanted although the season pass is nice with exclusive skins, bonuses and materials to make life easier and faster. 

I can go on and more but wanted to highlight some of the more talked about points to dispel some confusion. Despite some of the reviews, it’s a great game but definitely not for everyone. Would I recommend it to a person who has a wife and kids and can only play an hour a day? It would probably take you awhile to progress and there are better games for casual play. Do you have 2-3 hours a day to spare a day or even a couple days a week? You can make it work. You still geta good amount of gameplay out of it if you don’t burn yourself out trying to get to max level fast….which for some reason, people feel inclined to move fast. I moved a bit fast myself but I still paid attention to the story and mingled with the community. Just live in the moment and enjoy it. While no mmo will ever replace old mmo gaming, this comes pretty close.

this game has alot of potential. the crafting and farming is really fun. playing with friends and pvp is fun. its a great game overall but endgame is really stale and needs more content. can get really repetitive. its gotten alot better since its launch. and if the developers stay on it and listen to the community it can be top tier. 8.1/10

I'm ... disappointed.

There are a number of game mechanics that are awesome and the graphics are really good. I'm disappointed because for all the polish, the couple of pinch points are really bad.

1. Gear drops are 100% random. In 45 levels I've maybe found class gear three times. Everything I'm wearing I've had to make.

2. Classes are very ambiguous. It's almost like, if you put the stats in (and you can respec whenever) and have the gear for a class type, you are now that class. It's a little confusing tbh.

3. The story moves VERY fast. I stopped to do a few side quests and found myself outpacing the main story line by several levels. A little more time collecting the materials to build all my gear due to #1 and now I'm like 15 levels ahead of the main story. Just ... Why?

4. I started this thinking I would have a longer list, but like the games content, it ran out early.

This is one of the hardest Review I have had to do for any game I've reviewed on steam. I have put in just over 100 hours since buying this game about a week ago and I have been enjoying it, for the most part... It's easy to say that for everything I like about the game, there is something about it that I dont like. If you haunt played it you have to go into the game knowing that just about any game that has a PVP focus is going to come with a majority of immaturity. In my 100 hours I have met three people who didnt put out vibes of a teenager trying to seem cool in a room full of adults. There is also NO name restrictions for guilds or characters, so there are a lot of... creative.. Names. The chat system is a cluster, causing people to not know if they're getting a direct message and a lot of the community have the different chats off because of the trying-to-be-cool-teens. However if you do meet someone, make a friend and quest together or take down a giant boss, dungeon or PVP together, like any mmo, always makes the game better.

The war system is a cool, but complicated system, unlike games like conquerors blade where people can just up and take it with numbers.. this game provides lots of stages and gives both sides preparation before one side can overtake the other. It's a steep learning curve, but getting into a Company (Games Guild System) can help with that.

On the topic of companies, I got pulled into one recently and they do not like new people, most people I've interacted with dont.. There are lots of tutorials and websites on the internet to answer questions and I suggest you find them because if you ask a question in this game, you will get laughed at... teens..

But with all its downsides brought on by a not-so-friendly community, If you have friends to play the game with it is a good game.. The structured PVE is fun but doesn't hold you hand like some MMOs, PVP is unforgiving, causing you to focus because one bad move can turn the tide and ruin the match for your team. The questing is hard, but fun.. Picking a class you like and learning to survive with it is great, however, with a no class system you can always switch.

Overall, I wish the community was a little more new friendly, but I, like many others, turn my chat off and enjoy the times when the teens are in school and the game is fun.

A Thrilling Adventure for the Whole Family: New World Aeternum

As a family of five, finding a game that engages everyone can be a challenge. However, New World: Aeternum has become a staple in our household, delivering thrilling adventures and immersive gameplay that we can't get enough of. We play together almost every evening, and it's been a fantastic way to bond and explore a rich, vibrant world.

New World: Aeternum is an MMORPG that takes you to the mystical island of Aeternum, where adventure awaits around every corner. The game's stunning visuals and dynamic environments draw you in from the moment you start. Each member of our family, from the youngest to the oldest, finds something to love—whether it's exploring uncharted territories, battling fearsome creatures, or crafting and trading to build our collective strength.

What truly sets New World apart is its versatility. The game offers a wide array of activities, ensuring that everyone finds their niche. My eldest enjoys the strategic PvP battles, while my youngest is fascinated by the crafting and gathering systems. The rest of us revel in the thrill of co-op dungeons and faction wars, often strategizing and laughing together as we take on new challenges.

The community aspect of New World is also a highlight. We've formed alliances with other players and families, expanding our in-game circle and enhancing the experience. The camaraderie and teamwork have made our nightly sessions something we all look forward to.

Moreover, the game developers are constantly updating and improving the game, which keeps it fresh and exciting. The seasonal events and new content ensure that there's always something new to discover, keeping our family hooked.

New World: Aeternum has become more than just a game for us; it's a shared adventure that brings us closer together. If you're looking for a game that offers endless exploration, epic battles, and a chance to create lasting memories with your family, this is it. We can't recommend it enough!

Summary: I can't recommend this game anymore, but I do respect the good times provided to me, and the people I had the great honor to meet through this game.


 Expanded: I've been playing since testing phases and launch day, and because of that I really got to enjoy the journey of what made this game great and unique as it grew into the game it is now. Cross-play is HUGE for an MMO and I love that they did that. While it didn't launch with the most amazing range of content, it still had a major strength in it's game-play and design by allowing players to experience every part of the game on a single character (Weapons, armor, professions, etc. which rewards your time as a player). I was still able to find creative ways to enjoy the game. For example, I would get together with some buddies, we would invite everyone we could on the server to the middle of a town, and DJ lengthy inner town shows where everyone would be naked and use the fire-staff to shoot flamethrowers everywhere.

 I did my best to keep my love for this game, but it currently can't quite find it's own identity and suffers from trying to copy other Live service methods that are not widely enjoyed or healthy to the game, but more so healthy to keep money into the pockets of the people running the game. Which I wouldn't mind, people need to be paid and servers need to be ran. However, it becomes a sad sight when the primary highlights of content releases for this game take the form of refurbishing old areas and quests, a seasonal pass model that expires even when you have paid for it, and a lengthy list of other smaller issues that add up to discourage enjoyment. The map is a good example, as there appears to be such a MASSIVE amount of map space that is not available yet, and has not been available or given to players except in the form of on expanded region and an already existing zone, refurbished to house the PAID DLC Rise of the Angry Earth. A large list of unreleased weapons being slowly drip fed to players over a ridiculously long time, is also another notable issue.

I'm ONLY giving this game a thumbs up because I had great times in the world of Aeternum, with so many good people, doing all kinds of fun stuff with what was given to us at the time. That being said, with nothing but love and respect to the AGS team, I cannot find any reason to continue spending my time in this game any longer. If there ends up being a huge positive shift in the games direction and expansion, I'll gladly be open minded to the growth and coming back to experience it. I'm rooting for both the game and for AGS.

Thank you guys for everything, I now lay this game to rest.

The looks good, but feels like a wet noodle. I don't know if its just the overall feel, the music, the writing or all of it combined. Its a strong concept, and the combat is fun, but it has that 'I read this mediocre fantasy novel in middle school, it had conquistadors in it, can't remember what it was called or who was in it.' feel.

Its probably way better than it was before, but I get the impression they made the game easier until end game, much easier. There's no ammo for weapons anymore, lock on for ranged, andit gets easy to overlevel resulting in a kind of aimless 'I'm already more powerful than everything around me, can we please get to the big bad already and kill it.'

Maybe I'm just burnt out on the MMO genre, but the most fun thing was crafting, and I can think of a couple games that do that better too.

Visually impressive, the tone is a Fortnite put on its grown up face, but didn't actually get any older.
Audio is good, with cracks from pickaxes and muskets having properly loud and impactful reverb and depth.
Structurally, the game seems like it went into a blender with a bunch of 'this is what MMOs have, right?' and came out the other end.

Its a mediocre game that may possibly be a great game for someone who finds a good community or really dives into the PVP on the extreme competative end. The rest is just kind of window dressing that looks nice, but has clearly very talented and enthusiastic people behind it accompanied by just as many 'phone it in, this won't be a Game of the Year' people.

It could have been what I'd hoped to get out of Elder Scrolls Online, instead it does the combat one better, and then feels about as hollow as ESO everywhere else. I couldn't really even milk the Hour/Dollar margin out of it fishing, which should tell you what the rest of this didn't.

New World is a game that had the potential to redefine the MMO genre with its unique mix of survival mechanics, open-world exploration, and large-scale PvP battles. The concept is truly genius, offering a visually stunning world and a sandbox experience that could have been a masterpiece. Unfortunately, the execution by Amazon Game Studios is nothing short of disappointing.

From the very first release, New World has been plagued by bugs, many of which remain unfixed to this day. For example, in the Outpost Rush mode, you still cannot see who killed you—an issue that has been pointed out repeatedly by the community but ignored by the developers. Comfort features are also glaringly absent. Simple quality-of-life improvements, such as the ability to sort items in your inventory or storage by name, are still missing, making inventory management a frustrating chore.

The lack of attention to such basic details is baffling, especially for a studio with the resources of Amazon. While the core gameplay and concept are undeniably captivating, the persistent bugs and missing features make it hard to stay engaged. It feels like the game was rushed to market and then abandoned, leaving players to deal with half-baked mechanics and unresolved issues.

If Amazon Game Studios could invest more time and effort into fixing the numerous issues and listening to player feedback, New World could become the MMO it was meant to be. As it stands now, however, the game is a frustrating mix of brilliance and incompetence.

Final Verdict:
Great concept, poor execution. Proceed with caution if you're considering diving into Aeternum.

UPDATED: 
I paid roughly $40 for this game and it just wasn't worth it. This game offers about 10% of what Elder Scrolls Online does and you can pick that up for 5-10 bucks these days. There is no endgame in New World. No prestige system. No champion system. No reason to stick around. Attempting to queue for group events is a waste of time because of the low player count. This game is already past its Amazon Prime and Amazon needs to convert this to free-to-play or its going to crash and burn. I played 600+ hours of Elder Scrolls Online and... yep, I'm going back. There's nothing of substance here. PvP looks like "shoot musket, roll and dodge, repeat" except for the smoothbrains that brought big swords into a gun game. Might as well play COD then. I would recommend this game if you get to play it for free, but honestly, I have absolutely no idea how people are putting more than 50 hours into this without getting completely bored because the zones aren't even level-scaled. If you miss a zone (and by the construct of the story, you will), do you really want to go and do a level 40 zone at level 60? Wtf? Nope. We're done here. 

This is overrated dogshit. Barely three years old and this game is already dying, and that's in spite of the "refresh". That's terrible for an MMO. Elder Scrolls Online, despite being a 10 year old game, has more concurrent players than this shit. More people still play WOW and OSRS. Yeah... this game never deserved the hype. Suck my balls for wasting my forty dollars. 

Reached Level 65, took one look at the sorry excuse for an "endgame" and gtfo. Amazon Games Studios... more like Made in China Studios, give me a break with this dogshit.

No suelo hacer reseñas pero esta poronga me salio 42 dólares, y me siento cagado arriba de un puente, asi que voy por puntos:

Diseño de mundo / personajes / arte visual: 9/10

El diseño de mapa, bichos y armas esta bastante bueno, el equipo de arte se saco la poronga, sobre todo en las dungeon donde tenes tremendos planos y visuales desde bosques, desiertos, corrupciones, sangre, etc.

Optimización: 1/10

El peor juego optimizado que jugue en mi vida, anteriormente dije que el diseño del juego esta buenisimo, pero los gráficos no dejan de ser algo parecido al Skyrim, y te va a reventar a pijazos tu PC haciendola calentar como puta ovulando.
El mapa te va a tardar en cargar, vas a ver todo invisible, bajonazos de fps ademas de que tenes que jugarlo de por si todo en bajo, ni hablar de querer poner fps a +60 para aprovechar los 140HZ+ de algunas personas, te explota la pc.

Mundo abierto: 7/10

Tenes varias actividades para hacer, tala, cosecha, cuerear animales, pescar y minar, con sus respectivos niveles (0 a 250).
También podes farmear bichos por sus items como cualquier juegito MMORPG. 
El problema de esto es que:
1) Los mercados están muertos: Ya no sirve farmear nada como debería servir, ya que las nuevas dungeon del ultimo dlc te tiran los mejores items, dejando hecho mierda el lvlear las profesiones.
2) No te sirve dedicar tanto tiempo a todo lo del mundo abierto, por ejemplo supongamos que lvleamos crafteo de armaduras, el máximo lvl que podes craftear es 700, tardarás unas 200hs en conseguir todo lo necesario para ese lvl 700 de armadura, y aun asi, en una sola dungeon del ultimo dlc ya tenes asegurado partes de armaduras de 700+. 

Juego en solitario: 4/10

En este juego no te podes divertir jugando solo, todas las dungeon y eventos importantes requieren gente, porque? No hay build que sea destructora en solitario, no te podes solear bichos fuertes, ni dungeons con poca gente siendo "ultra op", por lo que sumado a lo que dije anteriormente, tener 200hs+ para conseguir todo un set crafteado por vos, no te sirve de nada porque todavia asi, no vas a poder solearte nada importante.

Comunidad: 5/10

El juego en PvE está muerto, o si no agonizando.
Llegas a querer pedir gente para hacer una Dungeon y vas a tardar 20m+ en encontrar, si queres mandar una dungeon específica vas a estar +40m a +2hs, por lo que jugar solo no es una opción. 
Se tarda eso porque ya el 98% de las dungeon que existen están obsoletas y no sirven ni dropean nada bueno, solo las dos ultimas de dlc, por lo que la gente abandono completamente estas actividades (que son las mejores como dije mas arriba)

Juego en equipo: 9/10

Tenes rol de daño, de tanque, y de healer. Cada uno debe cumplir su rol en una dungeon, hacen lo tipico de estos roles, no hace falta explicar. Si tenes un grupo o amigos este juego lo disfrutas un montón, siempre y cuando no vayas al pvp donde hay gorditos con +2000hs y equipamiento fulleado para pvp.

PVP: 5/10

Rancio. Se puede spamear un esquive cada 1.5s, y lo roto es todo lo que pegue a distancia. No hay variedad en roles de pvp mas que lo que está en meta. Si sos un hijo de mil puta que le gusta jugar armas melee te vas a cagar de aburrimiento jugando guerras o 3v3, vas a necesitar siempre un compañero que pegue a rango ya que si alcanzas a un mago/arquero te empieza a dar saltitos cada 1.5s, te ralentiza y stunean y te moriste. No hay variedad de pvp mas que lo que dicta el juego, como ya dije por la falta de perks/opciones en la armadura/defensa.

en conclusion, es un juego que disfrutas mucho con +3 amigos, sino no lo vale. Con 60 dolares te compras 3 4 juegitos mas divertidos que esto, o te vas al Albion Online.

For a game with an expansion I was expecting more from it.

Am Anfang macht das Spiel wirklich Spaß, vor allem in den ersten Leveln. Grafisch kann es definitiv überzeugen.

Die Einführung von Reittieren und die Möglichkeit, endlich richtig schwimmen zu können (peinlich, aber wahr), waren mit dem Aeternum-Update zunächst wirklich vielversprechend. Dazu kamen endlich Cutscenes, die es im ursprünglichen Spiel nicht gab.

Das Kampfsystem hat mir ebenfalls gut gefallen, weil ich es tatsächlich mochte.

Doch je weiter man spielt, desto enttäuschender wird es. Es gibt einfach viel zu viel unnötigen Loot und gleichzeitig viel zu wenig wirklich interessanten Content, der einen motiviert, weiterzumachen.

Das Housing-System ist zwar eine nette Idee (man kann sein Haus dekorieren, andere Spieler einladen, hat einen zusätzlichen Respawnpunkt und etwas mehr Lagerplatz) aber wirklich herausragend ist es nicht. Wer sich an das Housing-System von ArcheAge erinnert, weiß wie es eigentlich sein sollte.

Am Ende fühlt sich alles nur noch wie eine endlose Wiederholung an, ohne dass man das Gefühl hat, wirklich etwas erreicht zu haben. Und versucht mal, als Solo-Spieler eine Gruppe zu finden. Es gibt zwar eine Suchfunktion, aber die ist fast immer leer und wenn doch mal jemand auftaucht tritt niemand bei.

Aus Frust habe ich das Spiel wieder deinstalliert und meinen Charakter gelöscht. Die erneut sinkenden Spielerzahlen sprechen für sich, und ich bin wohl nicht der Einzige, der so denkt.

Firstly I want to point out that any reviews saying you have to buy the game again are wrong. I bought the game once when it launched, paid for the expansion when that came out, and didn't have to pay a dime to continue paying for the relaunch. So those comments are just fake news.

Secondly, you have to take negative reviews on MMORPGs with a grain of salt. There are people who legit get more enjoyment writing bad reviews that offer nothing in the way of constructive criticism than they do from actually playing the games. It reminds me of WoW players who talk all day on their forums about how much they hate the game, yet haven't played anything else for 20 years. With this game, people made their impressions based off its launch (which had problems) and refuse to change their opinion from their, despite all of the progress it's made.

Bottom line, this is a good game. The action combat is fun, the graphics are great, and it has a lot of good systems. It's got a solid player base that's only expanded after cross-platforming with consoles, it's a B2P model with ZERO pay to win features, no subscription, and a lot of great content for both PVE and PVP players. Is it perfect? No. But you shouldn't be swayed away from trying the game because of negative review bots who aren't saying anything in good faith anyway. You can easily sink 1k hours into this game and have a good time and that would be worth the box price alone. In terms of PVP it might be one of the best skill-based MMORPGs out there, and I don't think people have really caught on to that fact yet. 

The game is in the best spot it's been in for a while. Don't judge it from a questionable launch years ago. Aeternum is a good MMO.

Cons outweigh the pros with this game.  

Pros:

1.  Nice art style and graphics.
2.  Audio engineering is great.
3.  Combat system is fun to play for both PvE and PvP.

Cons:
1.  Over all the community is really immature, childish and bad.
2.  Game has baked in design features that encourage poor behavior.
3.  Game does not have baked in features that encourage respectable behavior.  
4.  Twitch streamers / currency vendors put content behind pay walls.
5.  Old school players that know the game gatekeep content, thus hampering the games growth and longevity.  New people may have a rough time with unwelcoming / elitist old schoolers and may very well not get their moneys worth out of it.
6.  Extra charge for expansion if you want to see end game content, or 80 bucks for the full version -- see above.  
7.  Only game I am currently playing that desktop crashes, slows down and has to be shut down in the middle of content, which in turn triggers the immature gatekeepers to behave poorly.  
8.  Over engineered with too many menu's and sub menu's.  World immersion suffers as a result.  
9.  Convoluted upgrade paths for gear requiring out of game research for many people.
10.  Server side disconnects happen too often.  

Can't recommend it.  There are funner, healthier games out there for much less cost.

Now, if you are a soloer and into tradeskilling and don't care about the community content, you could have fun for awhile, but ultimately not worth the purchase prices just to do that.

Let me preface this by saying that I am quite enjoying my time in Aeternum. It is a fun game, but I would not call it an MMORPG. It lacks the most significant elements of an MMO. I would say it's more like Conan Exiles. Is that a bad thing? No, not really.

The game opens with you creating your character and then proceeds with you on a ship in the early 1600s, straight off a port from Amsterdam. Some unspecified time in your journey, your ship crashes headfirst into an ominous looking storm. You fight your way to survival on a burning ship against what looks like demonic zombies and wake up on a mysterious island, in which you are quite literally thrust right into the thick of a story that I...am honestly not even quite sure about. lol 

The strengths of New World is what keeps me coming back, at least for now. 

[b]⫷ Graphics ⫸[/b]

The assets are very well made, especially foliage and trees and general buildings, and is further enhanced by truly beautiful colors. Everything is vivid and stands out (perhaps, to an extent, to a fault concerning UI), and I truly enjoy just looking at how beautiful the world of Aeternum is. I actually enjoy walking through the woods or sitting atop a mountain top and moving the camera around to catch different angles. 

[b]⫷ UI / Interface ⫸[/b] 

One of it's major problems is UI. The overall designs are very good. The inventory categories could stand out a bit more with actual dividers instead of "Rewards, Tools" etc etc, but overall, their design choices are fine. The issue is that they seemed to have just stopped at "Yo, we need a good pause menu and inventory". So, basically, there's a general lack of and a few bugs/issues.

Where is the group UI customization options? Why can't I pin members of my group to my compass? Why can't I assign them colors? And why isn't there a minimap? You have to pause and open your map any time you want to track your group or anything at all. 

[b]⫷ Sound Effects / Music ⫸[/b] 

It's very good. The sound effects at least are incredible. I really love the sound of mining and chopping trees, and love that I can hear others logging or mining if I'm close enough. The sharp TACK it makes at contact is extremely satisfying. The sound of the guns or the animals or the wind etc etc is very good. 

The music is really good, but nothing to write home about. 

[b]⫷ Controls / Controller Support ⫸[/b] 

I initially played it with keyboard and mouse. I hated it. I really do not know how people are playing the other way, except maybe because for some reason when you play on controller, it super zooms you in. The controller support makes the game feel even more like it's just an RPG game your friends can jump into, because it feels like it was designed with controllers from the start.

[b]⫷ Character Creator ⫸[/b] 

It's honestly one of the worst out there. You have such a limited range of options. On top of that, all color options are extremely limited too. And even worse, guess what? There's no way to change your appearance later on, not even your hair. Another token into the basket of "Doesn't feel like an MMO to me". 

They need to revamp this shit and fast. The people I got into the game nearly quit right there. More options would help out immediately, and the ability to change appearances.

[b]⫷ Combat ⫸[/b] 

It's not a TAB semi-stationary target MMO. It's a strange combination of Diablo IV and Lost Ark, I would say. On keyboard, you move with WASD. Q, R, and F are your abilities. The 1 and 2 keys is to swap weapons but strangely the tilda key (~) is "put weapon away" and guess what? You go slower if your weapon is out, and somehow the best option to put your weapon away was ~ key. lol TAB is your inventory. ESC is your pause/bigger menus. Right click = guard and left click is "attack". Don't bother with guarding, it's practically useless. Oh, and space bar is jump.  

You engage combatants as you would in a more action orientated game. You run up to them and can move around and use items and what have you as you fight. Again, a lot like Diablo IV or Lost Ark--or if you played it, very similar to Throne and Liberty.

It's okay. Nothing terrible, nothing spectacular.

(combat feels much better with a controller)

[b]⫷ Enemy A.I ⫸[/b] 

It's bad. 

The enemies are like rocks that can swing at you sometimes. And frustratingly enough, most of them have absurd speed, so they attack relentlessly. Which isn't hard, just fucking annoying. lol

[b]⫷ The World ⫸[/b] 

The world is beautiful as I said above, but it's extremely small in the grand scheme of things. Another reason it doesn't feel like an MMO at all. I think what would greatly help New World, is to focus future expansions on new lands. They might have written themselves into a corner with the whole "island" plot but whose to say they can't have our heroes expand their horizons? Maybe they can fall into the Bermuda Triangle next and arrive at Hollow Earth to fight King Kong. lmao either way, expand zones dramatically, or you will 100% see the death of this game.

[b]⫷ Story / Lore ⫸[/b] 

I honestly have no idea if there's a real story going on here but hey, you can collect lore books!

[b]⫷ Crafting / Gathering ⫸[/b] 

Of all the MMOs I have played, it definitely feels like "the best". Now, I do think classic World of Warcraft and FFXIV generally have a better crafting environment (in what you can do with it), New World's gathering/crafting is truly a lot of fun. Maybe not fun to fight over nodes, but still so good that I genuinely believe it is the game's strongest aspect. The crafting is also very engaging, and usually requires other gathering professions involved to create things of importance.

It's my favorite part of the game easily. I would say the only way to improve, is to give us more to do with crafting/gathering itself. 

[b]⫷ Conclusions ⫸[/b] 

I haven't touched PVP or the town management yet, doesn't interest me, but Steam is complaining I can't write anymore, so yeah. 

Overall, a very enjoyable game, but definitely doesn't feel like an MMO to me at all. I'm not sure how long I will play, but I imagine once I beat it, I'll dip, because the world is just way too small to sustain these numbers or interest for long. Give up on those stupid ass seasons and give us ACTUAL expansions.

Get it on a sale if you wanna try it out.

O jogo melhorou muito em comparação ao que era no lançamento. As quests e sua progressão evoluíram bastante, com uma quest principal muito interessante que apresenta algumas das regiões do jogo e até personagens novos. Todas as quests possuem dublagem, o que, para mim, cria uma imersão muito positiva. O combate é divertido, e cada arma tem um estilo de jogabilidade único, o que torna a simplicidade do combate menos cansativa. Atualmente, boa parte dos conteúdos utiliza um sistema de fila, similar aos MMORPGs mais antigos, onde você define sua função e entra em uma instância com um grupo aleatório de jogadores.

O jogo está disponível em português, o que é ótimo para muitos que querem acompanhar as histórias, além de contar com servidores na América do Sul.

O único ponto negativo é o preço, que ficou bem alto após o lançamento do Aeternum. No entanto, pelo que vi, ele já inclui a expansão mais recente lançada, então pode valer a pena adquirir em uma promoção.

Итак, мини обзор на New World в январе 2025г

Перед началом добавлю, что ниже описана чисто субьективная картина, которая на истину не претендует. 
В ММО я поигрываю лет 15, со времен PW, L2, всяких Silkroad'ов и Metin'ов, но также пробовал и более новые проекты типа BDO, SOLO. С увеличением количества прожитых лет, хардкорно гриндить я все меньше и меньше готов, поэтому хочется более сессионного развлечения, но с ММОшной прокачкой, мили боевкой и разными активностями, для чего NW мне сейчас подходит

Личные плюсы и минусы NW:
Плюсы:
- Приятная нон таргет боевка как в ПВП так и в ПВЕ
Также можно чилово играть с дуалсенса (а можно и не чилово, рейд горгоны закрывал с геймпада. На геймпаде значительную разницу от клавомыши заметил только в ПВП на ренж пушках. На мили билдах разницы не увидел)
- Билдостроение
Можно экспериментировать с различными билдами и комбинациями пушек, а не "как обычно" в иных ММО: 1-2 оружия на персонажа, а хочешь новый геймлей - качайся заново миллион часов. Да, есть мета, но она не мешает развлекаться и пробовать новое
- Мало времени нужно для капа
За 274ч имею полтора кап персонажа: 1 с полностью финальными шмотками и 2й на половине. Для меня, как человека с работой и личной жизнью, который хочет вечерком сходить побить босса или порубиться в пвп с таким же гиром соперниками (а не как во многих ММО: качайся пол года по 10 часов в день, или задонать квартиру)
- Приятная графика и геймплей 
Не рвется глаз от старых механик и текстур, тк всё в этом плане современно и часто похоже на сингловую игру
- Нет pay to win - донат магазин в основном из скинчиков+сезонный пропуск

Минусы:
- Встречаются баги 
Чаще всего минорные графические или звуковые - то есть закрывать игру ради них не надо, но открыть лишний раз меню/инвентарь, или повторить действие бывает приходится
- Мало хай левел контента
Что дает ценность: раз в неделю ходишь в рейд горгоны. Остальные активности делаются в произвольном порядке (или не делаются). Мутации, честраны, ПВП трек и прочее. Вроде слышал, что хотят облегчить М3 и сделать, чтобы оттуда падали 725 шмотки - думаю это разнообразит развитие персонажей (кажется, 725 станет текущим 700) 
- Малое разнообразие ПВП контента
Тут пункт именно про разнообразие, а не про количество. При желании можно ПВПшиться нон стопом сколько хочешь пока не надоест (в отличие от многих ММО, когда ПВП привязано к датам/времени/событиям). Но самих активностей не много. Насколько я слышал из новостей, уже через пару недель добавят новую карту для ОПР, и это хороший вектор развития. Но до тех же БГ из ВоВ пока далековато

Резюмируя:
Если вы не хардкорный гриндер, который по 8 часов в день стоит на спотах в БДО, но любите жанр ММОРПГ и хотите иногда чилово залипнуть в компухтерную игрульку на пару часов, то можно рассмотреть NW. Но при этом если захочется челленжа, то его можно найти (для меня это были: первый раз пройти рейд горгоны, первые проходки мутаций М2+, осваивание ПВП)
great game

Game kinda just dies at the endgame. Gets particularly boring and apparently many of the exotic weapons don't work as intended(such as the current seasons), making the grind to get them kinda worthless. Progression also screeches to a halt once you reach the level cap of 65, something you'll hit before the expansion, with no other means of progression outside gear score.

I DO think the game was mostly enjoyable up until endgame, as far as MMO journeys go, and the world feels unique amidst the typical high fantasy stuff we get. But if you're looking for an MMO with endgame, you're gonna play WoW or FF14. If you're looking for mmo that's about the journey instead of the destination, you're gonna play ESO. Not to mention the countless other F2P MMO's out there.

Honestly, at this point, I think NW is a beta test for the LotR MMO.

Resenha: New World: Aetherum – NÃO RECOMENDO

Serei breve: NÃO RECOMENDO New World: Aetherum. E o motivo é simples: o jogo NÃO VALE O PREÇO COBRADO.
Comprei o jogo por R$ 327,89 e esperava uma experiência divertida para jogar com meus amigos. No entanto, logo percebi que essa “diversão” não estava nem perto de ser o que eu esperava. Aqui estão os principais motivos para a minha insatisfação:

 1. Preço x Valor:
New World: Aetherum simplesmente não vale o que cobram por ele. R$327,89 é um preço exagerado para a quantidade de conteúdo e a experiência que o jogo oferece. Eu diria que o jogo só vale a pena se custar no máximo R$75,00, e mesmo assim, com muitas ressalvas.

2. Problemas com as Quests:
Um dos maiores problemas do jogo é que as quests não são compartilhadas. Ou seja, se seus amigos estão mais avançados que você e você quer jogar com eles, não vai rolar. Você fica preso a fazer quests solo, enquanto seus amigos já estão em um estágio muito mais à frente. As missões que realmente permitem jogar junto, são todas muito mais pra frente no jogo e, para piorar, são dungeons extremamente chatas. A MER%4 É QUE COMPREI PRA JOGAR COM ELES… POUCO JOGUEI… :(

3. Falta de Progressão Junto aos Amigos:
Como o jogo não compartilha as quests, jogar com amigos que estão em níveis diferentes torna a experiência frustrante. Se seus amigos avançam muito rápido e você fica para trás, você basicamente vai ter que JOGAR SOZINHO até alcançar o nível deles (lembre-se do ponto número 2 acima, ou seja – não vai rolar) — ou se contentar com missões repetitivas e cansativas, enquanto aguarda para fazer conteúdo de grupo (que nunca fiz). Isso mata a ideia de uma experiência cooperativa e torna o jogo ainda mais monótono.

4. Dungeons Monótonas e Sem Diversão:
As dungeons, que são o conteúdo principal para quem quer jogar em grupo, são um verdadeiro saco. Elas são longas, repetitivas e não trazem nenhuma sensação de progresso ou recompensa real. Isso se torna um grande desânimo, especialmente porque essas são as únicas missões em grupo relevantes, e o jogo não oferece mais opções legais de cooperação.

5. E O PIOR DE TUDO: TER QUE FICAR ANDANDO PRA LÁ E PRA CÁ… CHAAAAAAAAAAATOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!! Como estava com presa de chegar no nível dos meus amigos acabei perdendo toda a LORE do jogo… O que deixou o jogo PIOR AINDA… 

Conclusão:
New World: Aetherum falha em muitos pontos importantes, principalmente na questão de progressão compartilhada e na qualidade das missões em grupo. A jogabilidade cooperativa, que deveria ser o ponto forte do jogo, acaba sendo um grande bloqueio, deixando os jogadores frustrados e desmotivados. Se você está pensando em gastar R$ 327,89 para jogar com amigos, sugiro procurar outra opção (ONCE HUMAN – TEM O DOBRO DE PLAYERS QUE esse jogo de @#$@#$@). Para mim, esse jogo não vale nem perto do que cobram por ele.

New World ist ein MMORPG, das mich auf Anhieb mit seiner beeindruckenden Welt und dichten Atmosphäre in den Bann gezogen hat. Entwickelt von Amazon Games, entführt es die Spieler auf die mystische Insel Aeternum, wo Abenteuer, Geheimnisse und Gefahren an jeder Ecke lauern.

Was sofort ins Auge sticht, ist die Grafik. Die Landschaften sind atemberaubend: dichte Wälder, schneebedeckte Berge, gruselige Sumpfgebiete und charmante Dörfer – alles ist mit einer Liebe zum Detail gestaltet, die die Welt lebendig wirken lässt. Dazu kommt ein dynamisches Wettersystem, das die Immersion noch verstärkt.

Das Kampfsystem ist ein echtes Highlight. Es ist actionbasiert und erfordert taktisches Denken sowie präzise Steuerung. Spieler können zwischen verschiedenen Waffen und Fähigkeiten wechseln, was eine Vielzahl an Spielstilen ermöglicht. Ob mit Schwert und Schild, Magie oder einem Bogen – jede Wahl fühlt sich einzigartig und befriedigend an.

Die Gemeinschaft spielt in New World eine große Rolle. Die Fraktionssysteme und Kriege sorgen für spannende PvP-Momente, während PvE-Spieler in Expeditionen und Weltbosskämpfen auf ihre Kosten kommen. Besonders die Möglichkeit, Siedlungen zu übernehmen und auszubauen, schafft ein einzigartiges Gefühl der Zugehörigkeit.

Auch das Crafting-System verdient Lob. Es ist umfangreich und belohnt Spieler, die Zeit und Mühe investieren, mit hochwertigen Ausrüstungsgegenständen. Die Sammelberufe wie Holzfällerei, Bergbau oder Angeln fügen sich nahtlos ins Spiel ein und bieten eine entspannende Abwechslung zu den actionreichen Kämpfen.

Natürlich hat New World seine kleinen Schwächen, etwa gelegentliche Balance-Probleme oder repetitive Quests, aber diese werden durch regelmäßige Updates und die aktive Community stetig verbessert.

Insgesamt ist New World ein großartiges MMORPG, das durch seine wunderschöne Welt, das dynamische Kampfsystem und den Fokus auf Zusammenarbeit und Konflikte besticht. Für alle Fans von Online-Rollenspielen ist es definitiv einen Blick wert!
