New world è come andare in vacanza alle Maldive ma essere allergici al sole e al polline. Immaginate di fare un bel viaggio fino al livello 65. Vi state divertendo, il gioco vi prende, tutte le cose che cercavate in un mmo ce le ha new world. Poi arrivate al livello 65 e iniziate a starnutire, ad avere prurito fino a quando realizzate che new world è la truffa videoludica piu grossa che abbiate mai subito. L'assistenza non esiste, crash continui senza motivo nelle arene con penalita non meritate. Ogni giorno un bug nuovo, che sia grafico o di comandi come ad esempio non poter premere il tasto esc perche il gioco non lo riconosce. Immaginate poi che vi comprate l'antistaminico e delle creme per proteggervi dalle vostre maledizioni e arrivano le zanzare e i serpenti: rimpiagerete di aver acquistato non solo il pack cavalcatura ma anche il gioco.
PRO: 
Paesaggi, Non pay to win, possibilita di avere una casa, poter cambiare classe quando si vuole, crafting decente, dungeon carini, stile di combattimento carino
CONTRO:
Animazioni del combattimento (il tuo pg andrà avanti con gli attacchi base fino a quando si metterà davanti al boss e verrà shottato dando agli altri l'impressione che non hai un cervello), la community è molto tossica,
Ricompense da fine dungeon o nel pvp davvero squallide, non esistono tutorial per i dungeon o per i boss dei dungeon, le skin-abbigliamento/armi sono davvero orrende, le texture degli npc sono fatte con i piedi, impossibilità nel creare un personaggio guardabile perché non ci sono personalizzazioni di qualità nella creazione del personaggio, dopo che acquisti il pack delle cavalcature per sbloccare devi fare missioni super noiose e se vuoi le cavalcature piu recenti come l'orso devi spendere altri soldi, quindi diciamo che lo stipendio potete canalizzarlo dritto su new world cosi fate prima, il colore nero si paga coi soldi veri e potete utilizzarlo solo una volta xD, ogni giorno un nuovo bug (credetemi ne vedrete delle belle), i tank sono super sbilanciati, si ricaricano tutta la vita e non si fanno niente e se li fate avvicinare vi battono con 3 colpi, i nemici sono solo di 4 tipi (scheletri, zombie, pirati e animali che poverini non c'entrano nulla)
Il gioco vi da l'impressione che potete fare quello che volete come volete e quando volete ma in realtà diventerete schiavi del meta, guardando tutorial su youtube senza usare la vostra fantasia e finirete per andare in 20 contro 1 e fargli pure il tea bag.

I’m a 31-year-old casual gamer, juggling a full-time job and other responsibilities. Like many, I can’t pour endless hours into gaming anymore; I typically manage around 10–12 hours a week, mostly on weekends. I grew up playing MMORPGs - with fond memories of World of Warcraft - but it’s been about 12 years since I last ventured into any online world. And let me tell you: New World feels like coming home!

From the moment I stepped foot in Aeternum, I felt a rush of nostalgia. It’s hard not to be impressed by the breathtaking graphics (especially on my 4070ti) and the combat mechanics that stand out from other MMOs I’ve played. Battles feel dynamic and fresh = there’s a great mix of dodging, blocking, and timing your strikes. The crafting system is incredibly rewarding; gathering materials, refining them, and crafting your own gear is satisfying and gives you a real sense of progression.

One thing that really defines my New World experience is the friendly community. Despite my limited playtime, I’ve already encountered wonderful players. From teaming up on quests to just hanging out in town, the social aspect of New World is a blast. A highlight for me was trying out the in-game music system with a group of strangers-turned-friends. Sure, we messed up a lot of notes at first, but it was all in good fun and brought back those carefree, joyful memories of my teenage gaming years.

I can’t speak much on the end-game content because I haven’t reached it yet, but I’ve heard plenty from higher-level players who are busy crafting, upgrading their gear, running PvP quests, and scouring the world for better chests. They seem to have their hands full, which is a promising sign of depth and longevity for those who want a long-term MMO experience.

Sure, the game isn’t perfect - but no game is. If we sit around looking for negatives, we’ll certainly find them. However, I entered New World with an open mind, especially after the recent updates, and I believe it deserves that fair chance. The positives here absolutely outweigh any negatives by a wide margin, and for me, it’s been a revitalising journey that brings back the best parts of MMO gaming.

This game is a mess at the moment. I wanted to take a look at the new addon. The first bug I encountered was in the menu. The graphics were glitching, and half the body of my character was missing.

Then I tried to join a server, but NW wouldn’t let me. After the loading screen, I got the message: "Suspicious software or broken installation detected." So, first I let Steam check my files. Everything was good.

I tried again... but the issue was still there. Then I tried to close some of the programs I run in the background. After closing Remmina (RDP), NW let me join without the error message. That's pretty messed up. But anyways, in-game, I realized all my weapon skill points were refunded. Not a big deal at all. So, I spent all the points to my liking, and after almost an hour of issues, I finally wanted to play the game. But right after spending the skill points and attacking an enemy, the game completely crashed. The picture froze but the music was still playing.

What a great experience.

New World has changed a great deal since it's open Beta however my review isn't going to be about the dets of all the tech.There are a million videos and reviews out there about that. As a long time gamer, here's my review based on playbility. 

 I've tried each incarnation and it feels like they've finally hit a note that works for both the casuals and the intense. I can play both and have my favorite way to play. I run with a large group of friends and we vary in styles and intensity. New world has finally found a balance for us all so everyone is having a great time, it's easy to play together, and chat while we're all doing our own thing. Will your intense player friends play forever? no. But they'll play for a solid few months and come back regularly for a weekend or three while you casuals can continue tinkering on at your own pace, collecting everything, doing everything, maxing everything when you have the time. THe point is, unlike many MMO's I've played, this one is nice to come back to and now that they've streamlined the basic required MSQ, it's easy to even start from nothing and enjoy the rebuild or save your end game character and pop in to play with your casual friends for some gorgeous dungeons. 

For me, I ignore the people that bitch about the cost. here's how it went. New world launched at full price. when years later it added new areas and mounts along with some other things, they lowered the price of New World to half and charged the same price for the new DLC with new land and mounts etc. it was a fair price given all the years New World had been out. Now it's combined the original and DLC to make one game and completely changed a lot of the game in massive ways so it's full price for both. It all makes sense and people who complain apparently think the world works for years on games for free.  Don't want to pay? By it on sale. 

Last thing I'll add. This game is colorful and bright without being overly cartoony. The weapons and mounts are ridiculously oversized so it's got an air of playfulness about it. It's a refreshing break from the dark dreary landscapes, settings and storylines of depressing impossibleness or anime styles of recent years. All in all. get some mates or find some in game. Most of the player base is now respectful at least if now just down right friendly and helpful. My review bottom line... It's worth it. If you don't bring friends with you, you'll make friendly acquaintances which come in handy in places where another person is helpful or sometimes required. The game does a good job at watching server populations and merging when necessary to keep enough people around to lend a hand and the end game ongoing raids, races, wars, dungeons, incoming assaults from npc's etc, keep the end game fresh because it's always a different group of people you're working with to succeed. 

Most importantly, I continue to see this game expanding and being worked on. Future things are coming and that's nice to look forward to and hang on for. My recommendation is Very Positive.

"New World" is an incredibly engaging MMORPG that stands out from other titles in the genre thanks to its unique blend of mechanics and exceptional visual design. The game transports players to the beautiful, danger-filled world of Aeternum, where you can shape your fate by choosing from a variety of professions, factions, and activities.

Graphics and World: The world of "New World" is incredibly detailed and full of life. From picturesque forests to mysterious ruins, every corner of the map captivates with its design and invites exploration. Beautiful, realistic textures, dynamic weather changes, and the passing of day and night make the game a visual masterpiece. As you travel through Aeternum, you truly feel as if you're in this extraordinary, perilous world.

Gameplay and Combat System: One of the greatest strengths of "New World" is its unique combat system, which blends RPG elements with dynamic, action-based fighting. Players must demonstrate quick reflexes and precise movements, not just rely on stats. This makes every fight—whether against monsters or other players—an exciting challenge. Additionally, the wide range of weapons and combat styles gives players tremendous freedom in shaping their characters and customizing their abilities.

Creativity and Customization: "New World" offers a wide range of customization options for both characters and equipment. Players can develop crafting skills, gather resources, create items, and even decide how their character will evolve. This is a huge advantage, as it allows each player to tailor their gaming experience to their preferences.

Social Interactions: The game places a strong emphasis on cooperation and competition with other players. Factions, PvP, and various in-game events provide players with numerous opportunities for interaction and rivalry. The robust economy based on crafting and trading also fosters strong player communities. Whether you prefer collaboration or competition, "New World" gives you plenty of opportunities to engage.

Challenges and Rewards: The game is full of challenges, from tough monsters to elaborate dungeons and dynamic territory wars. These challenges are well-balanced, and the rewards for overcoming them are satisfying. The game receives regular updates that add new content, ensuring that "New World" remains fresh and continues to offer new challenges for players.

Summary: "New World" is a title that combines elements of classic MMORPGs with modern features, offering players a dynamic, immersive, and diverse gaming experience. If you're looking for a game that features a beautifully designed world, exciting combat, deep character customization, and engaging interactions with other players, "New World" will surely captivate you. With its ongoing updates and development, the game has the potential to stay on your PC for a long time.

This game is so flawed that it would take forever to list all of the reasons not to play, but I quit for one simple reason: you can't set a maximum level for dungeon groups.

When you enter your first dungeon (annoyingly around level 25), you are forced to either look for party members manually, or allow the game to auto-fill your group. If you auto-fill, your party members will almost certainly be much higher level. This makes it nearly impossible to play the content in a normal way, without being carried. Shame on the developers for not adding one simple checkbox to limit the dungeon group level.

Aeternum is my first experience with New World, so my review is based on this version. Also note that for at least 50 hours I've been playing completely solo before joining a company. 

[b]Like:[/b]
- Voice acting is quite enjoyable
- Everything is unlocked in phases so you don't feel overwhelmed with the game mechanics
- Quests are fun to go through (including the side quests). Still not done with questing almost 60 hours into the game
- Story has interesting elements
- Cinematic reels for certain parts of the story (art is really nice in those)
- You're not locked into weapons or classes. You can change up your assigned skill points whenever you want + you can use all weapons. So you can really try out different builds and weapons and see what works for you.
- Leveling your skills has a real purpose behind it and it's not a terrible grindfest to go through
- I've always been a PVE player, never engaged with PVP in games. But in Aeternum the PVP stuff it's actually a lot of fun.
- Music is quite nice also and the sounds effects are great

[b]Dislike:[/b]
- NPC models aren't the most pretty. But honestly it doesn't bother me because the voice acting is good
- The in-game shop is way too expensive for the cosmetics
- The player driven economy is a hit and miss. I get the idea, but I would really like if there was also a NPC store where you could sell stuff.
- There are some wonky elements in the game but nothing game breaking
- There are no mounts of cosmetics you can unlock via expeditions etc

Overall I didn't expect to like the game as much as I'm currently doing. There are flaws in the game, but I can overlook that for the sheer fun factor I'm getting out of it.
Tons of flaws, developers disappoint again and again and again... but there is no better action combat MMORPG and that's the only reason this review is positive.

As someone who has played many MMORPGs such as WoW, GW/GW2, ESO, Rift, and more, I was excited to try out a new one and dive into a new world (no pun intended), and decided to give this one a go. 

I have just over an hour invested into this game and most of the time has been spent with the servers absolutely imploding on themselves to the point to where it became borderline unplayable and not an enjoyable experience whatsoever. 
It took multiple attempts to even open up the character creator, and everything takes ages to load up.

I haven't even talked about the bugs either. 
Egregious texture pop-ins, rendering glitches, the character creator background being a white screen with black boxes popping in and out while my character is a floating armor set, the map being a bunch of floating icons with no actual map showing, inventory being a blank screen, invisible NPCs, etc.

The first impressions left a very sour taste in my mouth, the game has been out for over 3 years and this is the state of the game?

It's upsetting because the game (when working properly) looks so beautiful, I enjoyed the look of the first settlement in the game and how many of the buildings in it you can own, I like the classes, it has great gameplay mechanics, and I enjoyed the combat. 

This game needs some serious work it seems.
I'll revisit it eventually, but for now I would rather spend my time on something else.
This game is amazing. Period.

Though it can sometimes take a long time to load the game on PC for whatever reason it still has a lot of things to do when you do get in the game. Combat is okay, nothing ground breaking. There is a lot of events and things to do to get achievements and level up so that keeps you pretty busy. Eu adoro esse jogo, e justamente por isso preciso dar nota negativa. Eles lançaram ele todo quebrado e incompleto. Foram consertando, mas perderam a base de players. 

O que qualquer empresa faria pra atrair gente? Colocaria de graça ou deixaria barato como era. Mas não, a AG colocou ele a preços proibitivos. Até a expansão que vem com o que o jogo base precisava ter tá mais cara que muito jogo novo. Depois eles reclamam que tá vazio. 

Quase R$ 400 o tornam inviável pra gente e pra muitos países e a gente fica com servidor vazio. Os devs consertaram os problemas na maioria dos casos e os executivos mexeram no que tava certo. Enquanto isso a gente vê jogos antigos como Fortnite e muitos outros que batem recordes e mais recordes de faturamento sendo gratuitos, só vendendo cosméticos. 

Ou os executivos gananciosos aprendem com quem faz certo ou a indústria dos games vai ficar bem mais ou menos como foi em 2024. 

AG, baixem esses preços, nos ajudem a ajudar o game a crescer.

Point positif :
Globalement très bon sur le contenu PvE. Le gameplay est bon, la progression est fluide et agreable avec une bonne évolution et gestion de la difficulté.
Le systeme de métier est riche et beaucoup moins ennuyeux que sur d'autres mmo.
Le housing est poussé.

Points négatifs :
Cependant le contenu PvP (chose pour laquelle j'ai acheté le jeu) est tres tres mauvais. 
Sur le contenu en lui meme : Il y a que deux modes, 20c20 ou 3c3.

Le mode 20c20 ressemble a un bordel sans nom, des barres de vie partout qui rendent les combats difficilement lisibles et surtout un équilibrage a la ramasse. Si vous etes un meta slave n'ayez crainte, il vous suffira de choisir la bonne arme et de rouler votre tete sur votre clavier pour venir a bout de vos adversaires les plus talenteux. Pour les autres, bonne chance.

Le TTK est completement différent d'une arme a l'autre, 3 à 5 coups de haches ou d'épee suffisent a tuer un distance, alors qu'un archer auras besoin de mettre au moins 10 à 15 fleches pour esperer tuer un joueur corps a corps à stuff équivalent (s'il n'est pas heal). Mais de toutes facons, arrivé au stade ou vous l'aurez presque tué, ce noble joueur partira simplement en courant en zig zag et vous ne le reverrez jamais. La montagne de fun :D

Il y a aussi des tanks ... litteralement intuables, comptez 2-3 bonnes minutes en 6v1 pour esperer pouvoir le deloger du point de capture, voir plus s'il exploite corretement la mécanique du bouclier et de la recharge de vitalié et s'il n'est pas heal ... Si jamais un heal arrive au moment ou vous etiez sur le point de le tuer c'est reparti pour 5 minutes, car la ou vous avez passé une éternité à lui enlever sa vie, il ne faut qu'une ou deux secondes au healer pour le remettre en plein forme, la montagne de fun :D 

Si vous avez été attiré par le gameplay au premier abord, je vous suggere de ne pas vous fier aux apparences, car les nombreux effets de controle rendront vos esquive parfaitement innéfficaces voir impossibles. La montagne de fun :D
Et tout ceci couronné d'un match making inexistant qui donne des partie si déséquilibrées en terme de composition qu'une des deux equipes au moins une fois sur 5 ne peut meme pas sortir du spawn. 

Ensuite la 3v3. Pour le coup le mode arène est bien mais il vous faudra passer 5 minutes en file d'attente pour un match qui en dure a peine 2 .. rien de plus a ajouter. 

Et pour finir l'open pvp. N'esperez pas pouvoir y prrendre part avant au moins 150 à 200h de jeu tant l'écart entre un joueur stuff ou non est immense. Vous ne pourrez y participer qu'apres avoir farmer vos items best in slot. MAIS, si comme moi vous avez innoncement fait le choix d'un build qui avait l'air de vous plaire sans vous soucier de la meta, c'est reparti pour des dixaines d'heures de farm :D. 
Car en effet, certaines classes sont tellement inutiles que les guildes ne prennent tout simplement pas ces classes dans les groupes pour participer aux guerres du monde ouvert.. 

Et cerise sur le gateaux, les grosse guildes des serveurs s'organisent en mafia en s'arrangeant pour se distribuer et conserver les territoires afin de conserver les benefices qu'elles en tirent. Ce qui donne des guerres d'influences quasiment désertes. 

En résumé, je peux le conseiller pour des joueurs PvE occasionnels, les fan de housing et les gens qui aiment les metiers dans les mmo. 

Pour les autres il n'en vaut a mon sens pas la peine. Il n'y a qu'un seul raid vraiment exigeant à 20 joueurs. 
Et pour les joueurs PvP qui cherchent un jeu pour s'amuser à travers la maitrise des mécaniques il n'y a ce stade aucun interet. 

Le jeu a quand meme du potentiel donc a voir dans un an.
